Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Data Scientist – NLP / LLM Specialist (Hands-On)




(Eventhough mentioned flemish region ,it's full remote, need European candidates)




📍 Location: Remote (EU Time Zones )

📝 Contract or Permanent | Start: ASAP




We’re looking for a hands-on Data Scientist with deep expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLMs). This is not an academic or purely research role, you’ll be building and deploying production-grade AI solutions that have a real impact.




💡 Why Join?

Work on cutting-edge LLM & Generative AI projects (LangChain, LlamaIndex, HuggingFace, etc.)
Deliver real-world, deployed solutions, not just proof-of-concepts
Join a fast-moving AI/ML team where innovation meets execution




🔧 What You’ll Do

Design & develop NLP and LLM-powered applications using modern frameworks
Build & fine-tune traditional ML models (classification, regression, clustering)
Create scalable APIs for AI models using Python + FastAPI
Deploy models to production environments (AWS, containerized architectures)
Apply best practices in CI/CD, testing, and observability
Collaborate with product & engineering teams to translate business problems into AI solutions




📌 What We’re Looking For

2–5 years professional experience in Data Science or Machine Learning
Strong NLP & LLM skills — both theory and hands-on implementation
Production-grade Python development skills (clean, testable code)
Experience with FastAPI (or similar) for model deployment
Familiarity with modern LLM stacks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, CrewAI, HuggingFace)
Solid understanding of ML libraries (scikit-learn, XGBoost, etc.)
Cloud knowledge (AWS ECS/Lambda/S3 or similar)
Bonus: MLOps tools (Docker, Terraform, CI/CD pipelines)




✨ Nice to Have

Knowledge of embeddings & vector databases
Cost-aware AI architecture & deployment skills
Previous remote-first team experience




💰 Compensation: Market-competitive (contract or permanent)

📅 Start Date: ASAP




📩 Interested? Apply now and bring your NLP/LLM expertise to a team that values technical excellence, creativity, and real-world impact.

Title: Junior Data Scientist & AI (€50k-€80k) - EU
Description:
Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,500,000 users come true!




We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals (with 0 to 3 years of experience) who aspire to join our team across Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a relevant role becomes available and your profile matches our requirements.




For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k) in the EU Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work in one of our offices or fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.




We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.

--




Responsibilities:

Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:

Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.
Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.
Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.
Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.
Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.




--




What We Offer:

Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:

Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.
Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.
Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.
Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.
Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.
Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.
Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.

--




Who We Are:

Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.




We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.




Our community includes over 1,500,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we’re growing fast—join us!

--




Contract & Compensation:

For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k).




Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.

--




Selection Process:

CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).

Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.

Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.

--




Why Join Our Team?

Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.

Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.

Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The ideal candidate's favourite words are learning, data, scale, and agility. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and ability to extract valuable insights from highly complex data sets to ask the right questions and find the right answers.

Responsibilities

Analyse raw data: assessing quality, cleansing, structuring for downstream processing
Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms
Collaborate with engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production
Generate actionable insights for business improvements




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in relevant field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
At least 1 - 2 years' of experience in quantitative analytics or data modelling
Deep understanding of predictive modelling, machine-learning, clustering and classification techniques, and algorithms
Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks and visualization tools (Cassandra, Hadoop, Spark, Tableau, Power BI)

  • Design accurate and scalable prediction algorithms

  • Fluency in a programming language (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer




Location: Brussels

Type: Freelance (Daily Rate)

Duration: 6 Months, with potential extension

Start Date: ASAP




Montash has partnered with a leading organisation to deliver production-ready AI solutions, and we’re now looking to engage a freelance AI/ML Engineer with a strong focus on industrialising machine learning pipelines.




The Role:

As an AI/ML Engineer, you’ll act as the bridge between Data Science and IT Production, ensuring that ML models are not only functional but fully integrated, monitored, and scalable in a production environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Build and automate robust ML pipelines ready for production deployment
Collaborate closely with Data Scientists to translate models into scalable solutions
Support deployment with CI/CD pipelines, containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes), and infrastructure alignment
Ensure continuous monitoring, retraining, and version control of models in live environments
Drive integration of AI services with appropriate data flow, ingestion, and real-time architecture




Required Experience:

3+ years in ML engineering or related production environments
Strong hands-on skills with Python (incl. async programming & optimisation)
Experience with Linux, Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab CI/CD, and PostgreSQL
Knowledge of AI platforms, Spark, ELT/ETL tools, and data visualisation is a plus
Agile mindset with strong communication skills and stakeholder awareness
Fluent in English and ideally Dutch/French




Interested?

If you're immediately available and this sounds like the right fit, please get in touch today with your CV and availability to shaip@montash.nl

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Job Title: AI/ML Engineer




Location: Remote (Europe based)




Industry: Life Sciences Quality Management SaaS




About Us: We are a SaaS company specializing in innovative quality management systems (QMS) tailored for the life sciences sector. Our mission is to ensure compliance, enhance quality processes, and improve operational efficiency through cutting-edge technology and AI-driven analytics.




Role Overview: We are seeking an experienced AI/ML Engineer to join our AI & Data Analytics team. You will lead and contribute to impactful projects that leverage advanced machine learning, analytics techniques, and large language models (LLMs). Your primary responsibility will involve designing, developing, and deploying AI-powered features to enhance our platform's capabilities.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement machine learning models, including applications involving large language models (LLMs), to enhance product capabilities.
Analyze structured and unstructured data, including text-based documents and event records.
Conduct data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and model validation.
Utilize semantic search techniques, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) methods, and advanced LLM-based frameworks.
Collaborate with product managers, software developers, and quality assurance teams to integrate and deploy AI features.
Monitor, evaluate, and optimize model performance continuously.




Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields.
3+ years of practical experience in data science, machine learning, or related roles.
Proficiency in Python and key libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas, and NumPy.
Experience working with LLMs.
Experience in semantic search, document retrieval, text analytics, and prompt engineering.
Robust analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience processing regulatory documents, compliance texts, or technical documentation in regulated industries
Experience fine-tuning LLMs.
Prior experience within SaaS or life sciences sectors.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and machine learning deployment processes.
Knowledge of vector databases and modern AI application architectures.




Soft Skills:

Effective communication and collaboration abilities.
Ability to translate complex technical solutions into understandable insights for business stakeholders.
Proactive mindset, attention to detail, and commitment to quality outcomes.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, innovative environment with opportunities to work on cutting-edge technologies.
Competitive compensation and benefits.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.

  • 3+ years of practical experience in data science, machine learning, or related roles.
  • Proficiency in Python and key libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas, and NumPy.
  • Experience working with LLMs.
  • Experience in semantic search, document retrieval, text analytics, and prompt engineering.
  • Robust analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience processing regulatory documents, compliance texts, or technical documentation in regulated industries
  • Experience fine-tuning LLMs.
  • Prior experience within SaaS or life sciences sectors.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and machine learning deployment processes.
  • Knowledge of vector databases and modern AI application architectures.


Soft Skills:

  • Effective communication and collaboration abilities.
  • Ability to translate complex technical solutions into understandable insights for business stakeholders.
  • Proactive mindset, attention to detail, and commitment to quality outcomes.


What We Offer:

  • A dynamic, innovative environment with opportunities to work on cutting-edge technologies.
  • Competitive compensation and benefits.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G’s supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;
    • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
    • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
    • Subsidized company restaurant;
    • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
    • Supporting employee's commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

    ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

    • Our hiring process consists of three main steps: 1) application, 2) online assessments and 3) interviews. Click here to get all the tips to be fully prepared.
    • P&G is driven to make life better, not just within the company, but across the globe. Click here to check out how we make a meaningful impact on the world.
    • We are the world’s largest consumer goods company. Click here to discover about our iconic brands.

    At P&G #weseeequal

    We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

    Job Schedule

    Full time

    Job Number

    R000127114

    Job Segmentation

    Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer | Brussels (Hybrid) | 12-Month Contract | €500-€750pd




Location: Brussels – 50% Remote

Duration: 12 months

Languages: English (mandatory), Dutch/French (a plus)




Are you a hands-on Machine Learning Engineer passionate about production-grade AI solutions?

We’re partnering with a leading financial institution in Brussels looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join their AI & Analytics team.




You’ll play a key role in developing, deploying, and monitoring ML services, bridging the gap between Data Science and IT production teams.




Skill & Responsibilities:

4+ years of relevant ML engineering experience
Design ML pipelines with production-readiness in mind
Automate model deployment using CI/CD (GitLab-CI)

AI/ML platforms, model & code versioning, package management
Bonus: Spark, ETL tools, data visualisation, model compression




If you are interested in the Machine Learning Engineer position, please apply with an up-to-date CV as soon as possible.

Title: AI /NLP/ ML Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI /NLP/ ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either on the company's premises or on site at the customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • AI solution analysis, design and implementation in close coordination with team management and AI technical lead;
  • Propose adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets;
  • Deliver AI and ML training to technical and non-technical (business) users;
  • Data modelling in the context of data science and AI;
  • Creation of industrial solutions to exploit data science and AI solutions;
  • Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management;
  • Engage with various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions

Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 13 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Minimum 5 years demonstrable project expertise in the command of Python and R proficiency in an AI/ML context focusing on the use of relevant libraries, including but not limited to: NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot;
  • Minimum 3 year project experience (expertise) of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing;
  • Minimum 3 years of professional experience in each of the following 3 areas in the context of Artificial Intelligence (or Machine Learning or Data Science or Data Analytics) projects: (1) Data Analysis; (2) Business Requirements Gathering; and (3) Project Management;
  • Minimum 3 years of hands-on, project-specific expertise using Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal) in a business environment;
  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP;
  • Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques;
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI and Machine Learning (statistical) models;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub/GitLab) and ETL tools (e.g. Data Services, Talend etc);
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation;
  • Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL would be considered an asset;
  • Excellent command of the English language and good command of French

Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (18271/02/2025).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Data Science and AI Expert
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Are you passionate about using data science and AI to real-world problems? At Sopra Steria, we’re looking for an experienced and versatile professional to help lead the design and delivery of advanced analytics and AI solutions across a wide range of domainssuch as public services, utilities, healthcare, mobility, and beyond.

In this role, you will work on impactful projects from ideation to delivery. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders transforming challenges into actionable insights and production-ready solutions. Whether it’s designing an optimization algorithm, building an LLM-based assistant, or delivering a forecasting pipeline, you’ll help clients unlock value from data.

We’re looking for someone who combines deep technical expertise with the maturity to take ownership, work autonomously, and guide teams and clients through the ever-evolving AI landscape.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries of digital transformation with AI. If you recognize yourself in most of the following, we’d love to talk:


You have at least 5 years of experience in delivering real-world AI and data science solutions in production environments.
You are proficient in Python and comfortable with frameworks like scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
You have practical experience with machine learning, and ideally exposure to domains like natural language processing, computer vision, predictive analytics, LLM’s or optimization.
You’ve worked with at least one major cloud provider (Azure, AWS, or GCP), and understand how to bring models into production securely and efficiently.
You understand how to balance model performance with business relevance, and how to translate analytical outcomes into actionable results.
You enjoy working in a team, guiding junior colleagues, and collaborating with clients to define solution architectures and technical roadmaps.
You’re comfortable interacting with stakeholders and can communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively.
Experience in project ownership, technical leadership, or contributing to AI strategies.
You are fluent in English, and speak either Dutch or French.


What We Can Offer You


A key role in one of Europe’s leading digital transformation companies, where innovation meets real-world impact.
The opportunity to work on high-impact projects in AI and advanced analytics across industries and public institutions.
A culture of collaboration and continuous learning, supported by an expert network of consultants, architects, and engineers.
Access to our Sopra Steria Academy, with a wide range of training opportunities and certifications.
A hybrid and flexible working model, with access to offices across Belgium.
Career development opportunities both locally and internationally, within a growing Data & AI practice.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
A major enterprise in the financial sector is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join its cross-functional AI & Data team. This role focuses on enabling production-ready Machine Learning pipelines and ensuring seamless integration of ML solutions into enterprise-grade systems.

You'll bridge the gap between Data Science and IT Operations by ensuring that deployed ML models are scalable, reliable, and continuously monitored, contributing to both the technical and business performance of AI-driven services.

Key responsibilities

Collaborate with Data Scientists to define and build ML solutions with production constraints in mind.
Design and implement automation for ML pipelines, including containerization (Docker/VM), testing (unit/integration/regression), and deployment using CI/CD tools.
Support the integration of AI services using existing industrial tools and platforms.
Work with IT Production teams to parameterize and maintain ML environments.
Ensure model reliability, retraining strategies, and monitoring across technical and business dimensions.

Required skills & experience

Professional experience

Minimum of 4 years of experience in a similar role
Prior experience working within Agile methodologies

Technical expertise (mandatory)

Containerization & Virtualization (Docker, VM)
CI/CD tooling (GitLab CI or equivalent)
AI platforms and development environments (IDEs)
Version Control (code, model, data)
Python programming
Dependency/package management
PostgreSQL

Technical expertise (nice to have)

Integration across varied tech stacks (e.g., distributed systems, mainframes)
Model optimization (e.g., compression techniques)
ELT / ETL pipelines
Big Data processing tools (e.g., Spark)
Data visualization and real-time data flow tools

Soft skills

Strong communication (written and oral)
Results-oriented with attention to detail
Creative problem-solver and continuous learner
Efficient, proactive, and adaptable
Team player who thrives in a dynamic, evolving environment

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist.
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Description Du Poste

Dans l'équipe AI&Analytics Solutions, nous voulons nous assurer que nous plaçons la prise de décision intelligente (augmentation humaine ou automatisée) au premier plan de nos processus/parcours en établissant une culture de données et d’expérimentation qui pourrait finalement devenir un avantage concurrentiel dans le monde en rapide évolution d’aujourd’hui.

Avez-vous une passion pour découvrir des insights à partir de données et les transformer en solutions impactantes ? Êtes-vous enthousiaste à l'idée de créer de la valeur commerciale à partir de données ?

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist dans notre équipe, vous allez :

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre et formuler leurs défis en tant que problèmes analytiques.

• Appliquer le machine learning, les méthodes statistiques et les techniques d’optimisation pour développer des solutions innovantes qui impactent l'entreprise.

• Concevoir, construire et évaluer des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs, en assurant leur fiabilité et robustesse.

• Diriger le cycle de vie complet des produits ML : de l'idéation et du prototypage à la mise en production et à l’évaluation continue.

• Collaborer avec d’autres Data Scientists pour partager des connaissances, bonnes pratiques, et améliorer continuellement nos méthodologies.

• Garantir la qualité et la performance de vos solutions par des tests rigoureux et une surveillance continue après déploiement.

• Contribuer à notre communauté data science en développant des ressources réutilisables, en partageant votre expertise et en participant à des initiatives d’innovation.

Profil

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist, vous avez :

• Au moins 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist/ML Engineer ou dans un rôle analytique similaire.

• Un master dans un domaine pertinent (ex. Mathématiques appliquées, Statistiques, Data Science, Physique, Informatique).

• Une solide connaissance pratique du machine learning, des statistiques et des techniques d’optimisation, avec une expérience concrète dans leur application à des problèmes réels. Expérience dans le développement, l’évaluation et le déploiement de solutions data science de bout en bout.

• Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data science courantes.

• Familiarité avec les environnements de cloud computing.

• Excellentes compétences en communication, capables d’expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences techniques et non techniques.

• Maîtrise de l’anglais, ainsi que du French ou Dutch.

Et vous êtes également :

• Passionné par la résolution de problèmes d’affaires avec des données et de l’analytics.

• Orienté résultats, capable de concilier excellence technique et besoins business.

• Curieux et désireux d’apprendre et d’expérimenter continuellement avec de nouvelles techniques.

• Collaboratif et capable de prospérer en équipe.

• Proactif, analytique et orienté solutions.

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgique

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler à la maison jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.

HTML:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Description Du Poste

Dans l'équipe AI&Analytics Solutions, nous voulons nous assurer que nous plaçons la prise de décision intelligente (augmentation humaine ou automatisée) au premier plan de nos processus/parcours en établissant une culture de données et d’expérimentation qui pourrait finalement devenir un avantage concurrentiel dans le monde en rapide évolution d’aujourd’hui.

Avez-vous une passion pour découvrir des insights à partir de données et les transformer en solutions impactantes ? Êtes-vous enthousiaste à l'idée de créer de la valeur commerciale à partir de données ?

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist dans notre équipe, vous allez :

• Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre et formuler leurs défis en tant que problèmes analytiques.

• Appliquer le machine learning, les méthodes statistiques et les techniques d’optimisation pour développer des solutions innovantes qui impactent l'entreprise.

• Concevoir, construire et évaluer des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs, en assurant leur fiabilité et robustesse.

• Diriger le cycle de vie complet des produits ML : de l'idéation et du prototypage à la mise en production et à l’évaluation continue.

• Collaborer avec d’autres Data Scientists pour partager des connaissances, bonnes pratiques, et améliorer continuellement nos méthodologies.

• Garantir la qualité et la performance de vos solutions par des tests rigoureux et une surveillance continue après déploiement.

• Contribuer à notre communauté data science en développant des ressources réutilisables, en partageant votre expertise et en participant à des initiatives d’innovation.

Profil

En tant que Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist, vous avez :

• Au moins 2 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist/ML Engineer ou dans un rôle analytique similaire.

• Un master dans un domaine pertinent (ex. Mathématiques appliquées, Statistiques, Data Science, Physique, Informatique).

• Une solide connaissance pratique du machine learning, des statistiques et des techniques d’optimisation, avec une expérience concrète dans leur application à des problèmes réels. Expérience dans le développement, l’évaluation et le déploiement de solutions data science de bout en bout.

• Maîtrise de Python et des bibliothèques data science courantes.

• Familiarité avec les environnements de cloud computing.

• Excellentes compétences en communication, capables d’expliquer des concepts complexes à des audiences techniques et non techniques.

• Maîtrise de l’anglais, ainsi que du French ou Dutch.

Et vous êtes également :

• Passionné par la résolution de problèmes d’affaires avec des données et de l’analytics.

• Orienté résultats, capable de concilier excellence technique et besoins business.

• Curieux et désireux d’apprendre et d’expérimenter continuellement avec de nouvelles techniques.

• Collaboratif et capable de prospérer en équipe.

• Proactif, analytique et orienté solutions.

AXA souhaite refléter la diversité de la société dans laquelle nous vivons et mène donc depuis des années une politique active en faveur de la diversité, de la non-discrimination et de l'égalité des chances. Dans ce cadre, nous garantissons un suivi égal et un accès équitable au recrutement, indépendamment de l'âge, de l'origine, du contexte culturel, du handicap, du genre, de l'orientation sexuelle ou d'autres caractéristiques.

AXA Belgique

Nous sommes plus de 3000 employés, travaillant dans nos bureaux modernes situés à Bruxelles, Anvers, Eupen et Liège. Nous servons 3 millions de clients en partenariat avec 3200 courtiers et nous sommes fiers d’être le premier assureur auto du pays. Notre ambition est de ne pas seulement être un payeur, mais plutôt un véritable partenaire pour nos clients.

Nos quatre valeurs principales nous poussent chaque jour à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes pour nos clients, tout en collaborant efficacement avec nos collègues: Customer First, Integrity, Courage et One AXA

Chez AXA, nous rejetons toute forme de discrimination déloyale ou illégale. Plus d’informations sur notre politique de Diversité et d’Inclusion.

Ce que nous vous offrons

Une rémunération et des avantages en lien avec votre travail

Vous bénéficierez d’un salaire compétitif, complété éventuellement d’un bonus discrétionnaire lié au résultat personnel et d’un bonus collectif, avec des chèques-repas, des écochèques, du remboursement total des transports en commun et un plan cafétaria.

Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur

Vous bénéficierez d’une assurance pension et d’une assurance hospitalisation et soins ambulatoires (également à un tarif préférentiel pour les membres de votre ménage) ainsi que d’une réduction allant jusqu'à 30 % sur nos autres produits d'assurance.

Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves

Un horaire flexible de 35 heures par semaine, 36 jours de congé par an pour vous ressourcer, ainsi que la possibilité de travailler à la maison jusqu'à 3 jours par semaine.

Vous bénéficierez de cours de sport au travail, de programmes de bien-être pour les employés et de formations, afin de vous maintenir en pleine forme, tant physiquement que mentalement.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
AI Data Scientist - Previous Pharma experience

Based in Europe - Hybrid/Remote

6 Month contract+




We’re seeking a contract Data Scientist with hands-on experience in Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI to join a global pharma leader driving the next wave of innovation in healthcare.




🔍 Key Responsibilities:

Design, fine-tune, and deploy LLMs (e.g. GPT, LLaMA, Claude) for use cases such as:
Literature summarisation, medical insights extraction, and automated reporting
Generative modelling for drug discovery or biomarker identification
Intelligent search across scientific publications and internal datasets
Collaborate with domain experts to ensure models are medically relevant, explainable, and compliant
Evaluate model performance and apply prompt engineering, retrieval augmentation (RAG), and fine-tuning as needed




✅ Requirements:

Proven experience applying LLMs or Gen AI in real-world environments (ideally within pharma, life sciences, or healthcare)
Strong skills in Python, ML libraries (Transformers, LangChain, Hugging Face, OpenAI APIs), and cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Familiarity with biomedical datasets, ontologies (e.g., UMLS, MeSH), or regulatory considerations is a plus
Comfortable working cross-functionally with data, science, and product teams

Title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer - Brussels - ASAP Start - Freelance/CDI
Description:
Company Description

Machine Learning Engineers promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the ML&AI community. They do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.

Job Description

They participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means they contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

ML Engineers are meant to facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.

ML Engineers contribute to Machine Learning projects by:


Working with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity, …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry, …)
Contributing to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests, …)
Supporting Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools)
Supporting IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment


Ensuring that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.

Additional Information

Technical Experience Required:


Containerization / virtualisation
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD (gitlab-ci)
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package manging tools and experience in dependency management
postgresql
Experience with integration using different technologies (distributes/mainframe) and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT / ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
💼Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

👨‍💻Job Type: Freelance / Employee

📍Location: Brussels, Belgium

🌐Language: Fluent English; Dutch OR French is required.

📄 Work Authorization: Valid work permit or combined permit to work in Belgium is required

🔥Keywords: Python, Machine Learning , IDEs (e.g., Azure ML, SageMaker, Jupyter, VS Code) , AI platforms




🧠 About the Role

We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who thrives at the intersection of data science and production engineering. You’ll play a key role in transforming ML models into scalable, production-ready solutions that deliver real business value.

🎯 What You’ll Do

Collaborate with Data Scientists to design ML solutions with production constraints in mind.
Build and automate ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD tools.
Deploy, monitor, and retrain models in production environments.
Ensure robust data flow, versioning, and model performance tracking.
Support IT teams in configuring and maintaining production infrastructure.
Promote best practices in ML engineering across teams.

🛠️ What You Bring

Must-Have Technical Skills
Python programming
Containerization (Docker, VMs)
CI/CD (e.g., GitLab CI)
AI platforms & IDEs (e.g., Azure ML, SageMaker, Jupyter, VS Code)
Code, model & data versioning
PostgreSQL
Dependency and package management

Nice-to-Have

Experience with distributed systems or mainframe integration
Model compression techniques
ETL/ELT tools
Big Data tools (e.g., Spark)
Data flow processing and visualization tools

💼 Business & Soft Skills

Agile methodology experience
Strong communication (written & verbal)
Detail-oriented and results-driven
Creative problem solver
Continuous learner with a proactive mindset
Open to feedback and innovation.




A little about us:

Innova Solutions is a diverse and award-winning global technology services partner. We provide our clients with strategic technology, talent, and business transformation solutions, enabling them to be leaders in their field.

Founded in 1998, headquartered in Atlanta (Duluth), Georgia.
Employs over 50,000 professionals worldwide, with annual revenue approaching $3.0B.
Delivers strategic technology and business transformation solutions globally.
Operates through global delivery centers across North America, Asia, and Europe.
Provides services for data center migration and workload development for cloud service providers.

Awardee of prestigious recognitions including:

Women’s Choice Awards - Best Companies to Work for Women & Millennials, 2024
Forbes, America’s Best Temporary Staffing and Best Professional Recruiting Firms, 2023
American Best in Business, Globee Awards, Healthcare Vulnerability Technology Solutions, 2023
Global Health & Pharma, Best Full Service Workforce Lifecycle Management Enterprise, 2023
Received 3 SBU Leadership in Business Awards

Stevie International Business Awards, Denials Remediation Healthcare Technology Solutions, 2023

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Role: Data Scientist

Duration: 6 months contract with possible extension

100% remote




This position is critical in driving innovations in semantic search, reranking methodologies, and evaluating search performance to deliver optimal, intelligent solutions. With expertise spanning multiple advanced domains, the Data Scientist will contribute significantly to building and refining systems that improve the relevance, accuracy, and efficiency of information access.




Roles and Responsibilities:

Design and develop models and algorithms for Information Retrieval and semantic search.
Implement and refine reranking strategies to optimize search results.
Evaluate and enhance search performance using qualitative and quantitative methods.
Apply Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence techniques to solve complex data challenges.
Integrate Generative AI capabilities into search and retrieval workflows.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, product managers, and UX designers, to align solutions with business goals.
Conduct experiments and A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of implemented algorithms.
Identify gaps and opportunities for improvement in search and retrieval systems.
Stay current with the latest research and advancements in AI, ML, and semantic technologies.
Contribute to technical documentation, reports, and best practice guidelines.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Strong background in Information Retrieval, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence.
Hands-on experience with Generative AI models and semantic search methodologies.
Proven expertise in reranking algorithms and search performance evaluation.
Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistical methods.
Experience with large-scale data processing and distributed systems.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, research-driven environment.




Tools and Technologies:

Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with Machine Learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Familiarity with search engines and libraries (Elasticsearch, Solr, Vespa, or equivalent).
Knowledge of NLP libraries and tools (SpaCy, Hugging Face Transformers).
Competency in using data processing tools (Spark, Hadoop).
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) for ML/AI deployments.
Strong knowledge of experiment tracking and evaluation tools (MLflow, Weights & Biases).

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.




Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:

You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals




Main Qualifications

Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing




Top reasons to work with us:

Flexibility is part of our DNA and you’ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, you’ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
You’ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer – 12 Months

Location: Brussels Hybrid (50% on-site) | Sector: Banking | Start: ASAP




A major banking institution is seeking a Freelance Machine Learning Engineer to help industrialize AI solutions by developing production-grade pipelines and ensuring seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.




Role Overview

You’ll collaborate with data scientists and IT teams to deliver scalable, reliable, and automated ML services. This includes designing infrastructure-aware solutions, automating workflows, and ensuring robust integration with existing systems.




Key Responsibilities

Co-design ML solutions with data scientists, taking production constraints into account
Automate and deploy ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD best practices
Implement model and data versioning, testing frameworks, and performance monitoring
Act as a technical bridge between AI teams and IT operations for deployment and maintenance
Ensure models are monitored, retrained when needed, and integrated with business metrics




Mandatory Skills

4+ years of experience in ML engineering or related roles
Strong Python development and CI/CD experience (e.g., GitLab CI)
Hands-on with containerization/virtualization (Docker, VMs)
Proficient in data/model/code versioning and dependency management
Experience with PostgreSQL and related tooling
Fluent in English; working proficiency in French or Dutch is a PLUS
Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and collaborative delivery




Nice to Have

Familiarity with Spark, ETL/ELT workflows, and data flow orchestration
Knowledge of legacy systems integration and hybrid infrastructure
Experience with model compression, performance tuning, or data visualization tools

Show more
HTML:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer – 12 Months

Location: Brussels Hybrid (50% on-site) | Sector: Banking | Start: ASAP


A major banking institution is seeking a Freelance Machine Learning Engineer to help industrialize AI solutions by developing production-grade pipelines and ensuring seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.


Role Overview

You’ll collaborate with data scientists and IT teams to deliver scalable, reliable, and automated ML services. This includes designing infrastructure-aware solutions, automating workflows, and ensuring robust integration with existing systems.


Key Responsibilities

  • Co-design ML solutions with data scientists, taking production constraints into account
  • Automate and deploy ML pipelines using containerization and CI/CD best practices
  • Implement model and data versioning, testing frameworks, and performance monitoring
  • Act as a technical bridge between AI teams and IT operations for deployment and maintenance
  • Ensure models are monitored, retrained when needed, and integrated with business metrics


Mandatory Skills

  • 4+ years of experience in ML engineering or related roles
  • Strong Python development and CI/CD experience (e.g., GitLab CI)
  • Hands-on with containerization/virtualization (Docker, VMs)
  • Proficient in data/model/code versioning and dependency management
  • Experience with PostgreSQL and related tooling
  • Fluent in English; working proficiency in French or Dutch is a PLUS
  • Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and collaborative delivery


Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with Spark, ETL/ELT workflows, and data flow orchestration
  • Knowledge of legacy systems integration and hybrid infrastructure
  • Experience with model compression, performance tuning, or data visualization tools

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Functiebeschrijving

In het AI&Analytics Solutions team willen we ervoor zorgen dat we slimme besluitvorming (menselijke augmentatie of geautomatiseerd) naar de voorgrond brengen van onze processen/journeys door het opbouwen van een datas en experimentatiecultuur die uiteindelijk een concurrentievoordeel kan worden in de snel veranderende wereld van vandaag.

Heb je een passie voor het ontdekken van inzichten uit data en het omzetten hiervan in impactvolle oplossingen? Ben je enthousiast om zakelijke waarde uit data te halen?

Als Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist in ons team, zal je:


Nauw samenwerken met bedrijfsstakeholders om hun uitdagingen te begrijpen en te vertalen naar analytische problemen.
Machine learning, statistische methoden en optimalisatietechnieken toepassen om innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen die zakelijke impact hebben.
Voorspellende en prescriptieve modellen ontwerpen, bouwen en evalueren, en zorgen voor betrouwbaarheid en robuustheid.
Leiding nemen in de volledige lifecycle van ML-producten: van idee en prototyping tot implementatie en voortdurende evaluatie in productie.
Samenwerken met andere Data Scientists om kennis, best practices te delen en onze methodologieën continu te verbeteren.
Zorgen voor de kwaliteit en prestaties van je oplossingen door rigoureus testen en voortdurende monitoring na deployment.
Bijdragen aan onze data science community door herbruikbare assets te ontwikkelen, je expertise te delen en deel te nemen aan innovatie-initiatieven.


Profiel

Als Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist heb je:


Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist/ML Engineer of een vergelijkbare analytische rol.
Een masterdiploma in een relevant vakgebied (bijv. Toegepaste Wiskunde, Statistiek, Data Science, Natuurkunde, Informatica).
Sterke praktische kennis van machine learning, statistiek en optimalisatietechnieken, met hands-on ervaring in het toepassen ervan op echte problemen. Ervaring met het ontwikkelen, evalueren en implementeren van end-to-end data science oplossingen.
Vaardigheid in Python en gangbare data science libraries
Bekendheid met cloud computing omgevingen.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe concepten uit te leggen aan zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
Vloeiend in Engels, evenals in French of Dutch


En je bent ook:


Gepassioneerd over het oplossen van zakelijke problemen met data en analytics.
Resultaatgericht, in staat om technische excellentie te combineren met zakelijke behoeften.
Nieuwsgierig en enthousiast om continu te leren en te experimenteren met nieuwe technieken.
Samenwerkingsgericht en gedijt in teamomgevingen.
Proactief, analytisch en oplossingsgericht.


AXA wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de diverse samenleving waarin wij leven en voert daarom al jaren een beleid van actieve diversiteit, non-discriminatie en gelijke kansen. In dit kader garanderen wij een gelijke behandeling en toegang tot selecties, ongeacht leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond, handicap, geslacht of seksuele geaardheid of andere kenmerken. Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af.

AXA Belgium

Meer dan 3000 mensen werken bij ons, vanuit onze vooruitstrevende kantoren in Brussel, Antwerpen, Eupen en Luik. We werken samen met 3200 makelaars. We hebben 3 miljoen klanten en zijn nummer 1 in autoverzekeringen. Het is onze ambitie om onze relatie met al onze klanten te transformeren van betaler naar partner om ons echt te onderscheiden.

Onze belangrijkste leidraad zijn onze waarden: Customer first, Integrity, Courage en One AXA. Alles wat we doen, daar staan we als één team achter.

Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af. Meer info in ons Diversiteits- en Inclusiebeleid.

Wat we aanbieden

Een mooie beloning voor je werk

Een competitief loon, eventueel aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een volledige terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer en een cafetariaplan.

Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar

Van groepsverzekering tot ambulante en hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten. 

Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen

Een flexibel rooster van 35 uur per week, 36 dagen verlof per jaar om op te laden, evenals de optie om thuis te werken, tot 3 dagen per week.

Wij bieden sportlessen op het werk, welzijnsprogramma's voor werknemers en trainingen, om u in topvorm te houden, zowel fysiek als mentaal.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to lead and contribute to a wide range of high-impact projects involving


Security analytics to enhance passenger and infrastructure safety
Punctuality optimization through predictive modeling and real-time data
Energy consumption analysis to support our sustainability goals
Generative AI applications to explore new frontiers in operational efficiency


As the scientific reference for our experienced team of data scientists, you will provide strategic guidance, ensure methodological rigor, and foster innovation across all projects.

Responsibilities


Lead the design and implementation of advanced data science solutions using Machine Learning, deep learning, and GenAI techniques
Act as a mentor and scientific authority for a team of skilled data scientists
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including operations, IT, and sustainability
Translate complex business challenges into data-driven solutions
Ensure best practices in model development, validation, and deployment
Drive the adoption of cutting-edge tools and methodologies within the team


Requirements

Conformity criterium:


PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics or AI field
10+ years of experience in data science, with a strong track record in both academic research and industrial applications
Proven track record in research within the Data Science and AI field: you have academic publications in the field.
Proven expertise in Azure cloud services and Databricks (including Spark, MLflow, Delta Lake, etc.): You are capable of setting up a data platform for a data science project and have it run several models in production on.
You have proven record of implementing Machine Learning, statistical modeling, and GenAI techniques to support companies in their decision making.
You have experience in bringing the models you create in production.
You have already used complex network in industrial context
You have worked in the railway sector for at least one year.
Fluent in English
You can come to the office on Tuesday and Thursday


Evaluation criterium:


Knowledge of required programming languages
Knowledge of the Azure environment for Advanced analytics
Knowledge of the railways business
Knowledge of the different data science techniques
Level of experience bringing ML and AI models to production
Capacity to translate complex business problems into actionable solutions based on Advanced Analytics techniques
Communication and presentation skills
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Cloud Systems (GCP)




We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with experience deploying and scaling models on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You’ll work closely with engineering teams to implement and maintain cloud-based ML solutions that are secure, scalable, and aligned with business goals.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy ML models on GCP
Build and maintain cloud infrastructure using best practices
Troubleshoot deployment and infrastructure issues
Improve performance, security, and scalability of existing systems
Collaborate on cloud strategy and architecture
Educate teams on cloud tools and technologies




Required Skills

Experience as a Machine Learning
Strong knowledge of GCP (Compute Engine, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, etc.)
Programming skills in Python, Java, Go, or Node.js
Proficiency with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD tools (Cloud Build, Azure Pipelines)
Understanding of cloud security (IAM, encryption, container security)
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code and automation
GCP certifications preferred

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote - Europe or Asia)
Description:
Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our partner companies is currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist - B2B based in Europe or Asia.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will join a distributed team focused on unlocking insights that power data-driven decisions for B2B initiatives. You'll work closely with other data scientists and engineers to explore user behavior, design impactful experiments, and develop strategic models that improve customer acquisition, retention, and product development. Your work will directly shape how professionals use digital tools at scale in a rapidly growing market segment. The team values autonomy, documentation, and async-first collaboration, with flexibility for remote work and timezone balance.

Accountabilities:


Analyze user behavior to uncover drivers of activation, engagement, churn, and upgrades
Lead experimentation efforts, including A/B test design and impact attribution
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to surface strategic insights and greenfield opportunities
Develop self-serve analytics tools, dashboards, and data literacy programs
Build and maintain predictive models and use case clustering solutions
Perform ETL tasks and model new data dimensions for strategic decision-making
Attribute product and marketing impact to core KPIs with statistical rigor



Requirements


6+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python or R, and modern BI/analytics tools (e.g., dbt)
Expertise in statistical methods, experimentation design, and machine learning techniques
Proven experience analyzing large datasets to solve business problems
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain insights to non-technical audiences
Strong stakeholder management and ability to influence cross-functional teams
Passion for continuous learning, fast iteration, and working in a dynamic, async environment



Benefits


Meaningful equity in a profitable tech company
Flexible remote work with sponsored visits to regional offices (Hong Kong or London)
Annual company offsite (e.g., Portugal 2023, Bali 2024)
Comprehensive medical insurance for you and your dependents
Home office and wellness budget (equipment, training, etc.)
Flexible working hours and an async-first work culture



Jobgether hiring process disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!


Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist

3 month contract (extensions likely)

Remote (Europe)

500 to 550 USD per day




We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist to join our clients team for an initial 3 month contract. You will be transforming unstructured customer data into actionable insights, leveraging advanced AI/ML techniques and Large Language Models.




Skills needed;

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
5+ years of experience working with Natural Language Processing and text mining.
ML model development (feature engineering, model training, evaluation, and deployment).
Python or R.
Power BI (data modelling and integration, including creating dashboards and reports).
REST APIs (integrating and interacting with large language models).




Preferred Skills;

Large Language Models (Google Gemini).
Google Cloud Platform for deploying and managing AI/ML solutions.
