Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!




ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.




Hoe wij (samen)werken?




Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.




Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?




Python & Java
Kubernetes & Kubeflow
AWS / GCP
Jupyter notebooks
Git
Tensorflow
Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
Wandb
MLFlow




Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?




Hard skills

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.




Soft skills

Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!




Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?




Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Show more
HTML:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde Machine Learning Engineer die ons helpt het Innovation Lab bij ACA verder uit te bouwen. Iemand die samen met ons wil groeien!


ACA’s Innovation Lab is het nieuwe businessconcept van ACA Group. In ons Innovation Lab groeien innovatieve ideeën uit tot gevalideerde businessconcepten.


Hoe wij (samen)werken?


Omdat wij een relatief nieuw team zijn, hanteren we geen ‘business-as-usual’ proces. We werken in een dynamische omgeving die eigenlijk vergelijkbaar is met een start-up binnen een groter geheel. ACA investeert een substantieel deel van haar winst in het “ACA Innovation Lab” zodat er ruimte is om nieuwe ideeën en technologieën af te toetsen.

We hebben bij ACA gekozen voor een proactieve aanpak om innovatie (AI en Machine Learning) bij onze klanten te stimuleren. Dit heeft ons de kans gegeven om samen met onze klanten een aantal nieuwe oplossingen te ontwikkelen door het gebruik van AI en ML.


Waar jij mee aan zal werken (tech & omgeving)?


  • Python & Java
  • Kubernetes & Kubeflow
  • AWS / GCP
  • Jupyter notebooks
  • Git
  • Tensorflow
  • Machine Vision toolkits (YOLO, OpenCV, …)
  • Wandb
  • MLFlow


Ben jij de geknipte persoon voor deze rol?


Hard skills

  • Je hebt minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring met Machine Learning.
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van het Engels en/of Nederlands.
  • Je hebt een goede kennis van software development.
  • Je flexibel kunnen opstellen in een dynamische werkomgeving. Prioriteiten stellen vormen voor jou dan ook geen probleem.
  • Ervaring in een test-driven development en Agile omgeving.


Soft skills

  • Je bezit goede communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Je bent een teamplayer, maar je gaat ook graag zelfstandig te werk.
  • Je bent proactief ingesteld en gemotiveerd om nieuwe uitdagingen aan te gaan!


Hoe voelt dat, werken bij ACA?


  • Innovatieve werkomgeving: je werkt met de nieuwste technologie en tools in een omgeving die innovatie uitademt.
  • Een aantrekkelijk loon, een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, onkostenvergoeding, MacBook Pro en nog veel meer.
  • Leren & groeien: bij ACA heeft iedereen een on-the-job coach. Je beschikt over een persoonlijk evolutieplan met een budget voor technische en professionele trainingen en heel wat kansen om bij te leren.
  • We’ve got your back: we voorzien een uitgebreid gezondheids- en verzekeringsplan om tegemoet te komen aan jouw noden. Het is onze prioriteit om ervoor te zorgen dat onze collega’s gelukkig zijn, o.a. door een goede work-life balans, de juiste tools te voorzien, enzovoort.
  • Onze unieke bedrijfscultuur: je bent deel van een passioneel en hardwerkend team dat trots is op hun verwezenlijkingen. ACA is een plek waar teamwork, transparantie, kennisdeling en erkenning centraal staan. Trots om ons "Great Place To Work" te noemen!
  • Jij staat centraal: wij zijn gedreven door onze teamleden waarbij iedereen hun steentje bijdraagt, maar waar plaats is voor heel wat fun. Een fantastisch team werkt niet alleen samen, maar maakt ook samen plezier. Daarom organiseren we heel wat activiteiten binnen en buiten onze kantoren en vertrekken we elk jaar op een spetterend ACA-weekend!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that’s transforming healthcare?




Lyfegen helps bridge the gap to faster, smarter access with pricing, access, and rebate management solutions. Our platform is used by health insurers, governments, hospital payers, and pharmaceutical companies worldwide to simplify the complexities of drug pricing agreements, optimise rebates, and drive better value.




As a global leader in drug access and rebate management, Lyfegen is expanding its reach and impact. As we continue to scale, we’re looking for passionate professionals to join us and help shape the future of healthcare.




We’re looking for an AI Engineer to play a key role in shaping our solutions. In this role, you will be leading and driving AI initiatives, optimising simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology— all to align business goals with technical capabilities.




At Lyfegen, we’re tackling challenges no one has solved before. That’s why we are looking for problem solvers with a proactive mindset—people who thrive on turning complexity into opportunity.




Join us and help bridge the gap to faster and smarter access to medicines for patients.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such LangChain, LangGraph.
Backend development experience with frameworks like FastAPI, Django, or Flask.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with databases, API design, and microservices architecture.
Understanding of MLOps practices, model versioning, and CI/CD for ML systems.




What we offer:

Join a company that improves access to healthcare for patients.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Experience an attractive and competitive compensation package aligned with the dynamic nature of a scale-up start-up.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Based in Belgium)
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!

At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of data-driven decisions?




About the job

🤠 What you’ll be doing

Lead the design and implementation of advanced machine learning models to solve high-impact business challenges
Architect and build robust, scalable data pipelines and data-driven solutions
Drive exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, correlations, and strategic insights
Develop and maintain complex predictive models, recommendation engines, and optimization algorithms
Translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for business leaders
Validate, monitor, and continuously improve model performance in production environments
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business stakeholders, to ensure data quality and alignment with business goals
Mentor and guide junior data scientists, fostering technical excellence within the team
Play a strategic role in shaping Movify’s data science vision, methodologies, and best practices







🤓 Skills & qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar advanced analytics role
Expert proficiency in Python or R, with a strong command of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Deep expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) and experience deploying models in production
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large, complex datasets in real-world environments
Solid background in statistics, probability, and hypothesis testing, with the ability to design rigorous experiments
Practical experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control tools (e.g., Git)
Exceptional ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including C-level audiences
A strategic, proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Fluent in FR or NL + excellent command of English
A genuine passion for transforming data into business value and driving strategic decision-making







😍 Movify Offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology, data, and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization’s infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Location:

Ghent & Brussels




What does your role involve?

Are you passionate about AI and eager to work with cutting-edge Microsoft technologies? We are looking for a Junior / Medior AI Engineer for an innovative organization in full growth. You'll join a dynamic environment where curiosity, initiative, and direct impact on business use cases are highly valued.




What you will do:

Design and implement AI solutions using Microsoft AI services (Azure AI, Azure ML, Cognitive Services)
Integrate models into Microsoft Fabric and data pipelines
Build proof-of-concepts and scale them into production-ready solutions
Identify new opportunities for AI across the business
Stay up-to-date with emerging Microsoft AI capabilities and share insights
Create reusable frameworks and document your work for future use




Who you are:

Experienced in AI development with Microsoft technologies
Skilled in Python and familiar with data engineering workflows
Interested in or experienced with Microsoft Fabric
Independent, curious, and solution-oriented
Able to translate abstract ideas into concrete solutions
Comfortable communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Solid background in Data Engineering (ETL/ELT)




What to expect:

Market-competitive salary with additional benefits.
Room for initiative within a dynamic, innovative company.




Ready to shape the future of AI?

Get in touch with us today!




More information?

Do you have any questions about this role or the application process? Feel free to contact Sophie Stroobants at +32 468 57 40 83 or send an email to Sophie@syfco.be.

Title: Python Engineer – HFT – fully remote - up to $150,000 Salary + Bonus
Description:
Your Python code could move millions in seconds.




Most Python roles are about building applications. This one is about building trading systems that make split-second decisions in global markets.




You’ll be helping to power the next generation of trading infrastructure, designing and building scalable, high-performance microservices all within a fast-paced environment. The other aspects will be to work closely with the wider team, collaborating with traders and other engineers to turn ideas into reality.




There are lots of projects going on but your initial focus will be helping to expand the exchange connectivity by adding new markets, building Python-based microservices for trading operations and developing features for funding rate prediction.




You’re going to ideally be coming from a HFT background, with a minimum of 5 years of experience developing Python based microservices. The team is small and spread across Europe so you will need to be independent and be able to push projects through autonomously. Where a lot of HFT environments require you to be on-site almost every day, this one gives you flexibility of where you're based.




This a global high-frequency trading firm, specialising in crypto markets and leveraging cutting-edge technology to shape the future of trading on real-time. Starting salary is around $150k plus bonuses.




If you want your work to shape real-world trading decisions in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, get in touch.




No up to date CV required.

Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application! 

You are fully convinced that data science isn’t a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence. 

Qualifications

We’re looking for someone who has:


A master’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer’s business context and challenges.
You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.


What we can offer:


A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.


Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application! 

You are fully convinced that data science isn’t a hype, but you also believe that, in order to be valuable and really make a company smarter, it must be done right. Your goal is therefore to create the most impactful solution possible in the quickest and easiest way possible so that real value can be extracted from data and artificial intelligence. 

Qualifications

We’re looking for someone who has:

  • A master’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, or a related field.
  • 2 to 4 years of hands-on experience developing and implementing AI/ML models in production environments.
  • Strong Python programming skills, including experience with API-building frameworks such as FastAPI and prototyping tools like Streamlit.
  • Experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar is considered a strong asset.
  • Solid understanding of machine learning including model evaluation techniques and familiarity with advanced applications such as: NLP, forecasting, optimization, computer vision.
  • Experience in working with cloud-based environments (Azure, AWS, or GCP) and ML pipelines is a strong asset.
  • Experience with Generative AI technologies, prompt engineering, and large language models, is a strong asset.
  • Hands-on knowledge of vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Pinecone, Azure AI Search) for semantic search and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines is a strong asset.
  • Strong communication and business analysis skills and genuinely interested in understanding the customer’s business context and challenges.
  • You can explain complex technical concepts in simple, accessible language to non-technical stakeholders.
  • A collaborative, open-minded mindset and a drive to keep learning in a fast-evolving field.
  • You're fluent in Dutch or French, as well as English.

What we can offer:

  • A dynamic role within OptimAI, a leading AI competence center focused on applied, impactful AI.
  • The opportunity to work on real-world projects across sectors, from logistics and government to healthcare and finance.
  • Access to expert colleagues, mentorship, and tailored learning opportunities to accelerate your growth.
  • A flexible hybrid work model and a strong focus on work-life balance.
  • A culture of innovation, inclusion, and continuous improvement where your ideas and input are valued.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.  

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:

  • A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
  • Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
  • The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.

People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.  

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application! 

At OptimAI, we combine the best of both worlds: data science and supply chain optimization. You will be part of a forward-thinking team where you can shape the future of data science and supply chain management. This is an excellent opportunity to make a real difference and grow your career in a field that is rapidly evolving and in high demand.

If you thrive on challenge, continuous learning, and want to make an impact in a fast-growing field, apply now to join the OptimAI Team.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

#STEM2025

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as: data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more

Title: AI /NLP/ ML Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI /NLP/ ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either on the company's premises or on site at the customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Architect, design, and implement advanced machine learning models, including but not limited to deep learning, reinforcement learning, and large language models (LLMs);
  • Collaborate with data scientists to refine data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training pipelines;
  • Deploy machine learning models and AI solutions into production environments, ensuringscalability, performance, and reliability;
  • Integrate AI models with existing systems and workflows, providing seamless functionalityacross platforms;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements andtranslate them into technical solutions;
  • Conduct rigorous testing and validation of AI models, including A/B testing, cross validation, and error analysis

Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Proven experience in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced machine learning models and AI systems;
  • Strong experience with large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques;
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure);
  • Experience with data processing and ETL tools;
  • Deep understanding of machine learning frameworks and libraries;
  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools;
  • Excellent command of the English language

Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (17576/09/2024).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist

Functiebeschrijving

In het AI&Analytics Solutions team willen we ervoor zorgen dat we slimme besluitvorming (menselijke augmentatie of geautomatiseerd) naar de voorgrond brengen van onze processen/journeys door het opbouwen van een datas en experimentatiecultuur die uiteindelijk een concurrentievoordeel kan worden in de snel veranderende wereld van vandaag.

Heb je een passie voor het ontdekken van inzichten uit data en het omzetten hiervan in impactvolle oplossingen? Ben je enthousiast om zakelijke waarde uit data te halen?

Als Machine Learning Engineer - Data Scientist in ons team, zal je:


Nauw samenwerken met bedrijfsstakeholders om hun uitdagingen te begrijpen en te vertalen naar analytische problemen.
Machine learning, statistische methoden en optimalisatietechnieken toepassen om innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen die zakelijke impact hebben.
Voorspellende en prescriptieve modellen ontwerpen, bouwen en evalueren, en zorgen voor betrouwbaarheid en robuustheid.
Leiding nemen in de volledige lifecycle van ML-producten: van idee en prototyping tot implementatie en voortdurende evaluatie in productie.
Samenwerken met andere Data Scientists om kennis, best practices te delen en onze methodologieën continu te verbeteren.
Zorgen voor de kwaliteit en prestaties van je oplossingen door rigoureus testen en voortdurende monitoring na deployment.
Bijdragen aan onze data science community door herbruikbare assets te ontwikkelen, je expertise te delen en deel te nemen aan innovatie-initiatieven.


Profiel

Als Machine Learning Engineer – Data Scientist heb je:


Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist/ML Engineer of een vergelijkbare analytische rol.
Een masterdiploma in een relevant vakgebied (bijv. Toegepaste Wiskunde, Statistiek, Data Science, Natuurkunde, Informatica).
Sterke praktische kennis van machine learning, statistiek en optimalisatietechnieken, met hands-on ervaring in het toepassen ervan op echte problemen. Ervaring met het ontwikkelen, evalueren en implementeren van end-to-end data science oplossingen.
Vaardigheid in Python en gangbare data science libraries
Bekendheid met cloud computing omgevingen.
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe concepten uit te leggen aan zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
Vloeiend in Engels, evenals in French of Dutch


En je bent ook:


Gepassioneerd over het oplossen van zakelijke problemen met data en analytics.
Resultaatgericht, in staat om technische excellentie te combineren met zakelijke behoeften.
Nieuwsgierig en enthousiast om continu te leren en te experimenteren met nieuwe technieken.
Samenwerkingsgericht en gedijt in teamomgevingen.
Proactief, analytisch en oplossingsgericht.


AXA wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de diverse samenleving waarin wij leven en voert daarom al jaren een beleid van actieve diversiteit, non-discriminatie en gelijke kansen. In dit kader garanderen wij een gelijke behandeling en toegang tot selecties, ongeacht leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond, handicap, geslacht of seksuele geaardheid of andere kenmerken. Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af.

AXA Belgium

Meer dan 3000 mensen werken bij ons, vanuit onze vooruitstrevende kantoren in Brussel, Antwerpen, Eupen en Luik. We werken samen met 3200 makelaars. We hebben 3 miljoen klanten en zijn nummer 1 in autoverzekeringen. Het is onze ambitie om onze relatie met al onze klanten te transformeren van betaler naar partner om ons echt te onderscheiden.

Onze belangrijkste leidraad zijn onze waarden: Customer first, Integrity, Courage en One AXA. Alles wat we doen, daar staan we als één team achter.

Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af. Meer info in ons Diversiteits- en Inclusiebeleid.

Wat we aanbieden

Een mooie beloning voor je werk

Een competitief loon, eventueel aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een volledige terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer en een cafetariaplan.

Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar

Van groepsverzekering tot ambulante en hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten. 

Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen

Een flexibel rooster van 35 uur per week, 36 dagen verlof per jaar om op te laden, evenals de optie om thuis te werken, tot 3 dagen per week.

Wij bieden sportlessen op het werk, welzijnsprogramma's voor werknemers en trainingen, om u in topvorm te houden, zowel fysiek als mentaal.
Show more

  • Vaardigheid in Python en gangbare data science libraries
  • Bekendheid met cloud computing omgevingen.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe concepten uit te leggen aan zowel technische als niet-technische doelgroepen.
  • Vloeiend in Engels, evenals in French of Dutch

En je bent ook:

  • Gepassioneerd over het oplossen van zakelijke problemen met data en analytics.
  • Resultaatgericht, in staat om technische excellentie te combineren met zakelijke behoeften.
  • Nieuwsgierig en enthousiast om continu te leren en te experimenteren met nieuwe technieken.
  • Samenwerkingsgericht en gedijt in teamomgevingen.
  • Proactief, analytisch en oplossingsgericht.

AXA wil een weerspiegeling zijn van de diverse samenleving waarin wij leven en voert daarom al jaren een beleid van actieve diversiteit, non-discriminatie en gelijke kansen. In dit kader garanderen wij een gelijke behandeling en toegang tot selecties, ongeacht leeftijd, afkomst, culturele achtergrond, handicap, geslacht of seksuele geaardheid of andere kenmerken. Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af.

AXA Belgium

Meer dan 3000 mensen werken bij ons, vanuit onze vooruitstrevende kantoren in Brussel, Antwerpen, Eupen en Luik. We werken samen met 3200 makelaars. We hebben 3 miljoen klanten en zijn nummer 1 in autoverzekeringen. Het is onze ambitie om onze relatie met al onze klanten te transformeren van betaler naar partner om ons echt te onderscheiden.

Onze belangrijkste leidraad zijn onze waarden: Customer first, Integrity, Courage en One AXA. Alles wat we doen, daar staan we als één team achter.

Bij AXA wijzen wij alle vormen van oneerlijke of onwettige discriminatie af. Meer info in ons Diversiteits- en Inclusiebeleid.

Wat we aanbieden

Een mooie beloning voor je werk

Een competitief loon, eventueel aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een volledige terugbetaling van het openbaar vervoer en een cafetariaplan.

Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar

Van groepsverzekering tot ambulante en hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten. 

Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen

Een flexibel rooster van 35 uur per week, 36 dagen verlof per jaar om op te laden, evenals de optie om thuis te werken, tot 3 dagen per week.

Wij bieden sportlessen op het werk, welzijnsprogramma's voor werknemers en trainingen, om u in topvorm te houden, zowel fysiek als mentaal.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Cloud Systems (GCP)




We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with experience deploying and scaling models on Google Cloud Platform (GCP). You’ll work closely with engineering teams to implement and maintain cloud-based ML solutions that are secure, scalable, and aligned with business goals.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy ML models on GCP
Build and maintain cloud infrastructure using best practices
Troubleshoot deployment and infrastructure issues
Improve performance, security, and scalability of existing systems
Collaborate on cloud strategy and architecture
Educate teams on cloud tools and technologies




Required Skills

Experience as a Machine Learning
Strong knowledge of GCP (Compute Engine, Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Functions, etc.)
Programming skills in Python, Java, Go, or Node.js
Proficiency with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, and CI/CD tools (Cloud Build, Azure Pipelines)
Understanding of cloud security (IAM, encryption, container security)
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code and automation
GCP certifications preferred

Title: AI /NLP/ ML Expert
HTML:
We currently have a vacancy for an AI /NLP/ ML Expert fluent in English, to offer his/her services as an expert who will be based in Brussels, Belgium. The work will be carried out either on the company's premises or on site at the customer premises. In the context of the first assignment, the successful candidate will be integrated in the Development team of the company that will closely cooperate with a major client's IT team on site.

Your tasks

  • Architect, design, and implement advanced machine learning models, including but not limited to deep learning, reinforcement learning, and large language models (LLMs);
  • Collaborate with data scientists to refine data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training pipelines;
  • Deploy machine learning models and AI solutions into production environments, ensuringscalability, performance, and reliability;
  • Integrate AI models with existing systems and workflows, providing seamless functionalityacross platforms;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements andtranslate them into technical solutions;
  • Conduct rigorous testing and validation of AI models, including A/B testing, cross validation, and error analysis

Requirements

  • Master's degree in IT or relevant discipline, combined with minimum 17 years of relevant working experience in IT;
  • Proven experience in designing, implementing, and deploying advanced machine learning models and AI systems;
  • Strong experience with large language models (LLMs) and natural language processing (NLP) techniques;
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure);
  • Experience with data processing and ETL tools;
  • Deep understanding of machine learning frameworks and libraries;
  • Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools;
  • Excellent command of the English language

Benefits

If you are seeking a career in an exciting and dynamic company, where you will offer your services as part of a team of a major European Institution, operating in an international, multilingual and multicultural environment where you can expect real chances to make a difference, please send us your detailed CV in English, quoting reference (17576/09/2024).

We offer a competitive remuneration (either on contract basis or remuneration with full benefits package), based on qualifications and experience. All applications will be treated as confidential.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) (www.eurodyn.com) is a leading Software, Information and Communication Technologies company, operating internationally (Athens, Brussels, Luxembourg, Copenhagen, Stockholm, London, Nicosia, Hong-Kong, Valetta, etc). The company employs over 1000 engineers, IT experts and consultants (around 3% PhD, 36% MSc and 53% BSc or equivalent). We design and develop software applications using state-of-the-art technology. The group generates annual revenues in the range of EURO 40 million, with an EBITDA in the range of 20%. The value of our contract portfolio exceeds EURO 250 million. EUROPEAN DYNAMICS is a renowned supplier of IT services to government institutions, multinational corporations, public administrations and multinational companies, research and academic institutes.

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, we are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

EUROPEAN DYNAMICS (ED) adheres to the General Data Protection Regulation principles by applying its Privacy Policy as published in www.eurodyn.com/privacy. By submitting an application to this position and by sharing your personal data with ED, you acknowledge and accept its Policy and authorise ED to process your personal data for the purposes of the company's recruitment opportunities, in line to the Policy.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Based in Belgium)
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!

At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of data-driven decisions?




About the job

🤠 What you’ll be doing

Lead the design and implementation of advanced machine learning models to solve high-impact business challenges
Architect and build robust, scalable data pipelines and data-driven solutions
Drive exploratory data analysis to uncover trends, correlations, and strategic insights
Develop and maintain complex predictive models, recommendation engines, and optimization algorithms
Translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for business leaders
Validate, monitor, and continuously improve model performance in production environments
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers and business stakeholders, to ensure data quality and alignment with business goals
Mentor and guide junior data scientists, fostering technical excellence within the team
Play a strategic role in shaping Movify’s data science vision, methodologies, and best practices







🤓 Skills & qualifications

5+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar advanced analytics role
Expert proficiency in Python or R, with a strong command of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Deep expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) and experience deploying models in production
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large, complex datasets in real-world environments
Solid background in statistics, probability, and hypothesis testing, with the ability to design rigorous experiments
Practical experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control tools (e.g., Git)
Exceptional ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including C-level audiences
A strategic, proactive mindset with strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Fluent in FR or NL + excellent command of English
A genuine passion for transforming data into business value and driving strategic decision-making







😍 Movify Offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology, data, and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NORRIQ is an international group based in Denmark and Belgium, comprising over 350 consultants dedicated to unlocking the full business potential of companies through technology and digital transformation.

We have a specialized Financial Services practice that is experiencing rapid growth. Over 100 consultants focus exclusively on the financial services sector, assisting banks and insurances in redesigning their operations to meet changing client expectations, adopt new technologies, and adhere to evolving regulations (DORA, RIS, AI Act, AML, KYC, etc).

At NORRIQ, our employees are at the heart of our organization and our success.. We hire and nurture passionate individuals who strive for excellence for both our clients and colleagues. Our culture supports personal and professional growth with training, opportunities, and creative freedom. Regardless of when you join or how long you stay, you'll experience an unforgettable NORRIQ journey and become a part of our extended family. Connected forever!

Role Overview

As an MLOps Engineer/AI Engineer, you will play a critical role in bridging the gap between Data Science and IT operations. Your primary responsibility will be to deploy, monitor, and optimize machine learning models and AI applications, ensuring seamless integration into the organization’s infrastructure. You will also contribute to lifecycle management, scalability, and performance optimization of AI systems.

Key Responsibilities


Model Deployment: Collaborate with Data Scientists to deploy optimized models for production, ensuring adherence to best practices for security, scalability, and reliability.
Data Pipeline Management: Design and implement automated and efficient data pipelines to support continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).
Environment Setup: Assist teams in setting up projects by managing dependencies, configuring environments, and integrating tooling for code quality, testing, and deployment.
Data Flow Design: Establish and maintain seamless data flows between sources such as Cloud Storage, SQL databases, and other platforms to support AI applications.
Lifecycle Management: Oversee the lifecycle of AI applications, including performance monitoring, regular updates, incident management, and troubleshooting.
Kubernetes Orchestration: Use Kubernetes to manage and streamline the deployment of containerized components, ensuring efficient resource utilization and system reliability.
Incident Management: Promptly handle incidents, troubleshoot issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders while conducting root-cause analyses and post-mortems.
Innovation and Optimization: Explore innovative solutions to enhance AI capabilities and streamline model integration processes.


Requirements

Education


Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Substantial knowledge in Programming, System Engineering, or DevOps is highly valued.


Technical Expertise


Strong proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with REST APIs and Git version control.
Proven expertise in MLOps/DevOps, including CI/CD pipeline automation.
Familiarity with containerization tools (e.g., Docker) and orchestration systems (e.g., Kubernetes).
Knowledge of software testing practices and Linux operating systems.
Nice to have : SQL, PostgreSQL, Mlflow, Helm charts.


Soft Skills


Collaborative and team-oriented mindset.
Proactive, results-driven, and adaptable in a dynamic environment.
Strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills.


Language Proficiency


Fluent in English (spoken and written).
Additional knowledge of other languages is a plus.


Why Joining Us?


You will be part of a fast growing international company with a unique people culture
A very competitive salary package including a company car, iPhone and different allowances
You will get extensive trainings in Belgium and Denmark on technical matters, as well as soft skills and project management, and you will have access to new technologies and innovative equipment.
You will join a dynamic and growing team with a great mix of young and experienced professionals focusing on financial services.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join a progressive environment where your contributions will shape the future of mobility through innovative data solutions. Be a part of a team that values safety, sustainability, and advanced technology in the rail transport industry.


We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist who possesses a blend of leadership and technical expertise, ready to tackle complex challenges that drive operational excellence and innovation.


You lead the design and implementation of advanced data science solutions using machine learning, deep learning, and GenAI techniques.
You act as a mentor and scientific authority for a team of skilled data scientists.
You collaborate with cross-functional teams including operations, IT, and sustainability.
You translate complex business challenges into data-driven solutions.
You ensure best practices in model development, validation, and deployment.
You drive the adoption of cutting-edge tools and methodologies within the team.


What are we looking for?


You hold a PhD or Master in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics or AI field.
You have 10+ years of experience in data science, with a strong track record in both academic research and industrial applications.
You have proven expertise in Azure cloud services and Databricks (including Spark, MLflow, Delta Lake, etc.).
You demonstrate strong problem-solving skills.
You exhibit excellent communication and presentation skills.
You are fluent in English, knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus.

Title: Business Analyst (AI/ML)
Description:
At Uni Systems, we are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a Business Analyst (AI/ML) to join our UniQue team.

What will you be doing in this role?

Definition of AI use cases within business processes.
Preparation of AI use case assessments.
Management of stakeholder requirements and translation into structured technical specifications for AI integration.
Development and maintenance of technical requirement documents for AI-driven solutions.
Coordination and review of AI use case documentation, implementation progress, and model performance (
Reporting of AI use case progress, risks, and stakeholder feedback to project leaders and business users.
Assistance with AI integration workshops.



Requirements



What do you need to succeed in this position?

Bachelor Degree with minimum 15 years of general IT experience (or Master Degree with minimum 11 years of experience).
Advanced understanding of AI technologies (Generative AI, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Large Language Models (LLMs), and Prompt Engineering).
Proven ability in requirement collection and translation.
Skilled in technical communication and documentation.
Experience in AI Use Case Identification, AI and Machine Learning Concepts and prompting engineering.
Demonstrated capacity of agile adaptation to evolving technologies.
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), Entry Certificate in Business Analysis (ECBA) or any AI and Machine Learning Certifications (Aws, Azure, Google etc.) will be considered an asset.
A good knowledge of the English language (minimum B2) is required (French will be an advantage).

Title: Director, Research and Strategic Initiatives
Description:
Based in Europe, the Eclipse Foundation is one of the world’s largest open source software foundations, with a proven track record of enabling community-led and industry-ready open source innovations used by millions of developers globally, earned over more than two decades. We host the Eclipse IDE, Adoptium, Software Defined Vehicle, Jakarta EE, Open VSX, and over 400 open source projects, including runtimes, tools, registries, specifications, and frameworks for cloud and edge applications, IoT, AI, automotive, systems engineering, open processor designs, and many others. Supported by over 300 members globally, the Eclipse Foundation has an established international reach and reputation.

The Eclipse Foundation is Europe's leading open source foundation for publicly funded research and innovation initiatives. Since 2013, we have participated in over 30 research projects in collaboration with more than 730 partners, with 15 projects currently active across critical domains such as artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, cloud computing, data spaces, software-defined vehicles, embedded systems, IoT, and open hardware. Our involvement in publicly funded research is a core pillar of our strategy. We help projects implement open source best practices, build sustainable communities, and accelerate research-to-market impact through effective dissemination and long-term open source stewardship. This role will shape the future of how open collaboration drives innovation at scale across Europe and beyond.

The Role

As a Director, Research and Strategic Initiatives, you will lead and expand our engagement in European and Member States funded projects. In this role, you will build strategic partnerships, lead our growing team of specialists, and engage with the rest of the Foundation’s leadership team to focus on initiatives that drive our overall mission. You will ensure the long-term success of the Foundation's engagement, and enhance our reputation with the European and national Institutions.

This position reports to the Vice President of European Operations and Policy and will lead a team of Research Project Managers who drive our involvement in specific European and Member States funded projects. You will oversee our various processes related to research and strategic initiatives, including overseeing the bid process, leading the engagement in consortia development, tracking and reporting of projects, and evangelizing our mission and our capabilities.

As the ideal candidate, you will have a strong understanding of the EU institutions, the overall EU research landscape, and ideally, have previous experience in building and managing consortia for European projects.

Responsibilities


Manage partnerships: Oversee and cultivate relationships with stakeholders, establishing and contributing to project consortia. Cultivate and sustain strategic partnerships with stakeholders, including EU institutions, NGOs and RTOs
Manage the team: Lead the team responsible for preparing project proposals, responding to calls for tenders, and fulfilling project commitments. Coordinate efforts with other relevant teams in the organisation
Project proposals: Manage project proposals as a project partner or the project coordinator and lead consortium-building efforts across EU member states
Project Delivery and Reporting: Supervise the execution and reporting of EU and other projects, ensuring adherence to budgetary and planning requirements, and manage relationships with EU project officers
Representation: Represent the foundation at EU-level events and conferences, advocating for the advantages of open-source software and its contribution to innovation and competitiveness
Strategy: Monitor upcoming calls for projects and tenders, and recommend to management on go/no-go decisions. Offer analytical insights, strategic direction, and support to the foundation's leadership regarding EU project opportunities that advance open-source software development and adoption
Growth. Actively identify and seek new opportunities for strategic engagement within the open source communities to enhance our position as the leading European-based, globally focused open source foundation


Qualifications

Required


Minimum of 6-10 years of relevant work experience in EU projects or similar
Demonstrated understanding of EU institutions and EU and government funding programs
Excellent writing skills, including proposal and report drafting
Strong management skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with experience building relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Excellent analytical and strategic thinking abilities, with the ability to synthesize complex information and develop and communicate effective policy solutions
Ability to work in a highly collaborative and distributed team


Preferred


Fluency in English is required. Proficiency in an additional language, such as German or French, is a plus
Experience in working with the open source software ecosystem and understanding of its potential to drive innovation and economic growth in Europe
Experience in coalition-building
Existing network in the research community and to funding agencies like VDI/VDE Innovation (please replace VDI with EU based project control orgs)
Education
Master or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent


Location of Position - Remote in Europe

What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits
A flexible, remote-friendly work environment
Opportunities to engage with a vibrant, global community of open source contributors and developers
Professional growth and learning opportunities in the rapidly evolving field of open source software


We offer highly competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted. For more information about Eclipse Foundation, please visit our website at https://eclipse.org/

Eclipse respects the dignity and independence of people with disabilities and is committed to providing accommodation and support to persons with disabilities throughout any recruitment process, once made aware of a need for accommodation. If you require any special accommodation or support during the recruitment process, please indicate in your email to us.

Show more
HTML:
Based in Europe, the Eclipse Foundation is one of the world’s largest open source software foundations, with a proven track record of enabling community-led and industry-ready open source innovations used by millions of developers globally, earned over more than two decades. We host the Eclipse IDE, Adoptium, Software Defined Vehicle, Jakarta EE, Open VSX, and over 400 open source projects, including runtimes, tools, registries, specifications, and frameworks for cloud and edge applications, IoT, AI, automotive, systems engineering, open processor designs, and many others. Supported by over 300 members globally, the Eclipse Foundation has an established international reach and reputation.

The Eclipse Foundation is Europe's leading open source foundation for publicly funded research and innovation initiatives. Since 2013, we have participated in over 30 research projects in collaboration with more than 730 partners, with 15 projects currently active across critical domains such as artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, cloud computing, data spaces, software-defined vehicles, embedded systems, IoT, and open hardware. Our involvement in publicly funded research is a core pillar of our strategy. We help projects implement open source best practices, build sustainable communities, and accelerate research-to-market impact through effective dissemination and long-term open source stewardship. This role will shape the future of how open collaboration drives innovation at scale across Europe and beyond.

The Role

As a Director, Research and Strategic Initiatives, you will lead and expand our engagement in European and Member States funded projects. In this role, you will build strategic partnerships, lead our growing team of specialists, and engage with the rest of the Foundation’s leadership team to focus on initiatives that drive our overall mission. You will ensure the long-term success of the Foundation's engagement, and enhance our reputation with the European and national Institutions.

This position reports to the Vice President of European Operations and Policy and will lead a team of Research Project Managers who drive our involvement in specific European and Member States funded projects. You will oversee our various processes related to research and strategic initiatives, including overseeing the bid process, leading the engagement in consortia development, tracking and reporting of projects, and evangelizing our mission and our capabilities.

As the ideal candidate, you will have a strong understanding of the EU institutions, the overall EU research landscape, and ideally, have previous experience in building and managing consortia for European projects.

Responsibilities

  • Manage partnerships: Oversee and cultivate relationships with stakeholders, establishing and contributing to project consortia. Cultivate and sustain strategic partnerships with stakeholders, including EU institutions, NGOs and RTOs
  • Manage the team: Lead the team responsible for preparing project proposals, responding to calls for tenders, and fulfilling project commitments. Coordinate efforts with other relevant teams in the organisation
  • Project proposals: Manage project proposals as a project partner or the project coordinator and lead consortium-building efforts across EU member states
  • Project Delivery and Reporting: Supervise the execution and reporting of EU and other projects, ensuring adherence to budgetary and planning requirements, and manage relationships with EU project officers
  • Representation: Represent the foundation at EU-level events and conferences, advocating for the advantages of open-source software and its contribution to innovation and competitiveness
  • Strategy: Monitor upcoming calls for projects and tenders, and recommend to management on go/no-go decisions. Offer analytical insights, strategic direction, and support to the foundation's leadership regarding EU project opportunities that advance open-source software development and adoption
  • Growth. Actively identify and seek new opportunities for strategic engagement within the open source communities to enhance our position as the leading European-based, globally focused open source foundation

Qualifications

Required

  • Minimum of 6-10 years of relevant work experience in EU projects or similar
  • Demonstrated understanding of EU institutions and EU and government funding programs
  • Excellent writing skills, including proposal and report drafting
  • Strong management skills
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with experience building relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Excellent analytical and strategic thinking abilities, with the ability to synthesize complex information and develop and communicate effective policy solutions
  • Ability to work in a highly collaborative and distributed team

Preferred

  • Fluency in English is required. Proficiency in an additional language, such as German or French, is a plus
  • Experience in working with the open source software ecosystem and understanding of its potential to drive innovation and economic growth in Europe
  • Experience in coalition-building
  • Existing network in the research community and to funding agencies like VDI/VDE Innovation (please replace VDI with EU based project control orgs)
  • Education
  • Master or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent

Location of Position - Remote in Europe

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • A flexible, remote-friendly work environment
  • Opportunities to engage with a vibrant, global community of open source contributors and developers
  • Professional growth and learning opportunities in the rapidly evolving field of open source software

We offer highly competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those to be interviewed will be contacted. For more information about Eclipse Foundation, please visit our website at https://eclipse.org/

Eclipse respects the dignity and independence of people with disabilities and is committed to providing accommodation and support to persons with disabilities throughout any recruitment process, once made aware of a need for accommodation. If you require any special accommodation or support during the recruitment process, please indicate in your email to us.

N’hésite pas à créer ton profil et activer un jobalert via le bouton « créer un jobalert » en haut de cette page ! De cette manière, tu suivras de près nos nouveaux postes vacants dans ton domaine d’intérêt grâce à nos mails d’alerte.

Bien entendu, tu peux également nous envoyer ta candidature spontanée en appuyant sur le bouton « postuler maintenant » en haut ou en bas de cette page.

Nous nous ferons un plaisir de découvrir ton profil avec le plus grand intérêt !

Ce que nous vous offrons


Un contrat de stage de 3 mois au minimum.
Des tâches et projets variés et passionnants.
Un encadrement sur mesure par des tuteurs passionnés et expérimentés.
Une expérience unique dans le secteur de la mobilité.
L’opportunité de développer vos compétences auprès de l’un des plus grands employeurs de la Région de Bruxelles Capitale.


Autres informations

Avant d’introduire votre demande, veuillez tenir compte des éléments suivants


Votre stage doit être conventionné et faire partie intégrante de ta formation.

Votre stage n’est pas rémunéré.
Le formulaire de demande de stage doit être entièrement complété et la demande introduite au plus tard 6 semaines avant la date de début souhaitée.
