Their CE-certified, Class IIa medical device is already available in over 10 countries worldwide—and they're just getting started.

As Aktiia enters a new growth phase, we're looking for a capable and visionary "Head of AI & Data Science" to scale their capabilities and lead a team that sits at the heart of the product innovation.

HEAD OF AI & DATA SCIENCE

Role & Responsibilities

  • Team & Project Leadership

Own planning, prioritization, and execution of AI & Data Science initiatives. Align roadmaps with product requirements and drive timely delivery with your team.

  • Cross-functional Collaboration

Act as the operational bridge between AI, Product, Marketing, Customer Support teams and the CTO. Solve blockers and ensure smooth collaboration.

  • People Development

Lead and grow a diverse team through coaching, recruitment, performance reviews, and day-to-day guidance - with a balance of empathy and results-orientation.

  • External Engagement

Interface with medical professionals, customers, and strategic partners. Incorporate feedback and deliver concepts, documentation, and visual materials.

  • Process Optimization

Define and implement workflows and structures that support scalable, efficient team operations.

Your profile

  • Academic Background

PhD in Informatics, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Data Science, Signal Processing or a related field.

  • Technical Expertise

5+ years of hands-on engineering experience in data science and ML/AI. Strong Python skills and familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn). Solid understanding of CNNs, RNNs and time series analysis. Medtech and signal processing knowledge (PPG, ECG) are a plus.

  • Leadership Experience

Several years experience of people management, ideally with responsibility for 10+ team members. Experience in fast-paced environments and team transformation.

  • Industry Fit

Background in regulated industries (e.g. medtech, pharma, fintech, aerospace). Experience in startups or mid-sized companies preferred.

  • Language Skills

English at highly proficient level is a must. French, German or Italian are advantageous.

  • Personality

Energetic, intellectually curious, hands-on and collaborative. A natural team leader who inspires others and leads with clarity and positivity.

Do you want to build something that changes lives while advancing science and technology? Then we're excited to meet you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

This Data Science position is embedded within the Analytics Team, which plays a pivotal role in developing tools and analyses that drive the day-to-day operations of Vitol. The successful candidate will leverage data science and machine learning to revolutionize how Vitol tracks and anticipates commodity movements across the globe.

While regular collaboration with the central Data Science team is expected, this role is uniquely positioned within the team of developers and analysts focused on vessel and cargo flows. This setup fosters knowledge exchange, process improvements, and regular interaction with various business units that depend on these analyses.

The ideal candidate will have a hands-on approach, ready to dive deep into data, build models, create visualizations, and deliver actionable insights as needed. They will thrive in a fast-paced environment and be motivated by seeing their work have an immediate impact on Vitol’s operations.

Key Responsabilities :


Be an energetic and enthusiastic team member, uniquely positioned to harness the power of data to transform the inner workings of the commodities industry
Gain a deep understanding of Vitol’s core operations and develop creative solutions using data, automation, analytics, models, and optimization to enhance these operations
Explore new datasets and external vendor predictions/algorithms, extract meaningful insights, and present results through visualizations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Work closely with domain experts to design and implement machine learning solutions that are both understandable and usable by non-technical stakeholders
Collaborate with the central Data Science team and IT department to leverage existing tools and capabilities to deliver value to the business


Qualifications


Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent experience
Strong foundation in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning or equivalent experience
Extensive experience in exploring and extracting insights from heterogeneous multi-dimensional datasets is essential
Proficiency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code in a collaborative development environment
Experience in visualizing complex data for diverse audiences using tools such as D3.js, Bokeh, Plotly or similar frameworks
5-7 years of industry experience as a data scientist on real-world datasets, is preferred
C# development experience is a plus
French language skills are an advantage but not required


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


Proven experience in working within an Agile Scrum development model
Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team
Proactive and user-focused approach, embodying a "make it work" mentality, with a genuine interest in both the functional and technical aspects of challenges encountered
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, enabling effective collaboration across diverse teams
Fluent in English, with full proficiency in business communication, both verbal and written
Passionate about leveraging data science and machine learning to innovate and disrupt traditionally human-centric industries
Skilled in deriving, abstracting, and translating value from complex models into actionable insights within a commercial context
Resourceful, creative, and adaptable, thriving in fast-paced, results-driven environments


What We Offer


Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Our Geneva office is located very centrally, 5 minutes from the main train station and 1 minute from the lake. The office has a rooftop lunch area, with views over the lake and Alps.
We organize regular activities to enable our people to meet colleagues from other teams in an informal setting, and to celebrate special achievements

Title: Data Scientist (80-100%, all genders)
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive decision-making? Do you enjoy implementing statistical models and see them come to life? We are looking for a hands-on data scientist who takes matters into their own hands and makes an immediate impact at Swiss WorldCargo.

Starting date: October 01, 2025 or upon agreement

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks


Design, develop and deploy data products that deliver value-adding insights for operations and commercial areas
Analyze commercial and operational air cargo data to uncover patterns and predictive opportunities and build corresponding models
Identify and implement automation opportunities to streamline manual processes
Design and evaluate statistically sound randomized, controlled experiments to assess commercial impact
Collaborate with IT and operational stakeholders to deliver high quality, sustainable solutions
Collaborate cross-functionally, sharing knowledge and supporting other teams on their data challenges
Communicate complex analytical insights in clear, business-relevant terms across all organizational levels
Help build and support SWC in its transformation to science driven decision making


Benefits


13th monthly salary
Flight benefits
Company health management
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Attractive company pension scheme
Subsidized parking or public transport
Diversity programmes
Remote working (e.g. from home)


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Engineering or related discipline
Minimum of 2 years of experience working with data, modelling and predictive analytics
Solid understanding and practical experience with cloud environments (MS Fabric preferred)
Hands-on experience of SQL for data preparation and exploratory analysis from complex data schemas
Proven proficiency in programming to support modelling efforts (Python preferred)
Comfort with statistical inference, regression, timeseries or related techniques (ML is a plus)
A proactive self-starter who thrives working in complex, evolving environments (entrepreneurial mindset)
Knowledge of airline/air cargo commercial environment or revenue management is advantageous
Fluent in English


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Diana Munzinger

recruiting.services@swiss.com


Show more

Title: Head of AI & Data Science
Description:
Company Overview

Imagine leveraging your expertise in AI and data science to directly improve the lives of millions of people living with hypertension. Hilo by Aktiia, is revolutionizing how cardiovascular health is monitored and managed. They've developed and commercialized the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor, empowering both patients and physicians with unprecedented insights into blood pressure patterns. Backed by over $100M in funding from top-tier investors across Europe and the US, Hilo is an early-stage, fast-growing startup rooted in over 20 years of research at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Their CE-certified, Class IIa medical device is already available in over 10 countries worldwide—and they're just getting started.

As Aktiia enters a new growth phase, we're looking for a capable and visionary "Head of AI & Data Science" to scale their capabilities and lead a team that sits at the heart of the product innovation.

HEAD OF AI & DATA SCIENCE

Role & Responsibilities


Team & Project Leadership


Own planning, prioritization, and execution of AI & Data Science initiatives. Align roadmaps with product requirements and drive timely delivery with your team.


Cross-functional Collaboration


Act as the operational bridge between AI, Product, Marketing, Customer Support teams and the CTO. Solve blockers and ensure smooth collaboration.


People Development


Lead and grow a diverse team through coaching, recruitment, performance reviews, and day-to-day guidance - with a balance of empathy and results-orientation.


External Engagement


Interface with medical professionals, customers, and strategic partners. Incorporate feedback and deliver concepts, documentation, and visual materials.


Process Optimization


Define and implement workflows and structures that support scalable, efficient team operations.

Your profile


Academic Background


PhD in Informatics, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, Data Science, Signal Processing or a related field.


Technical Expertise


5+ years of hands-on engineering experience in data science and ML/AI. Strong Python skills and familiarity with ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn). Solid understanding of CNNs, RNNs and time series analysis. Medtech and signal processing knowledge (PPG, ECG) are a plus.


Leadership Experience


Several years experience of people management, ideally with responsibility for 10+ team members. Experience in fast-paced environments and team transformation.


Industry Fit


Background in regulated industries (e.g. medtech, pharma, fintech, aerospace). Experience in startups or mid-sized companies preferred.


Language Skills


English at highly proficient level is a must. French, German or Italian are advantageous.


Personality


Energetic, intellectually curious, hands-on and collaborative. A natural team leader who inspires others and leads with clarity and positivity.

Do you want to build something that changes lives while advancing science and technology? Then we're excited to meet you!

Title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
Description:
Qui nous sommes




SII Group est un partenaire technologique de confiance, fournissant des solutions à forte valeur ajoutée pour les projets IT de nombreuses grandes entreprises. Depuis sa création en 1979, l’entreprise propose des solutions adaptées aux besoins de ses clients en s’appuyant sur :




> Son expertise reconnue dans divers secteurs et industries

> Des solutions « clés en main » éprouvées

> Un système qualité performant

> Des services adaptables et évolutifs




Aujourd’hui, avec plus de 18 000 collaborateurs, le Groupe SII accompagne des entreprises dans 20 pays.

Chez SII Suisse, nous attachons une grande importance au bien-être personnel et professionnel de nos collaborateurs. Nous plaçons nos équipes au cœur de nos actions et de nos activités. Si vous êtes motivé par la perspective de rejoindre un grand groupe reconnu et de confiance, rencontrons-nous !

Pour développer notre offre de conseil et accompagner l’un de nos clients, nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist / Data Analyst.







Missions




Concevoir et mettre à jour des tableaux de bord décisionnels adaptés aux besoins des différents utilisateurs (équipes soignantes, services administratifs, managers).
Faire évoluer et optimiser les tableaux existants en tenant compte des évolutions structurelles de l’hôpital.
Définir de manière autonome de nouveaux indicateurs clés (KPIs) et besoins analytiques.
Identifier proactivement les synergies entre les différentes sources de données et systèmes d’information.
Contribuer à la mise en place d’une infrastructure data en self-service pour les utilisateurs finaux.
Intégrer des technologies innovantes (intelligence artificielle, automatisation, agents intelligents) afin d’améliorer les processus.
Assurer une veille technologique active et proposer en continu des améliorations et évolutions.
Réaliser des tâches de maintenance régulières, y compris celles à faible valeur ajoutée, dans un souci constant de qualité de service.
Échange régulier avec les équipes métiers pour ajuster les livrables aux réalités terrain.







Profil




5 ans d’expérience minimum en Data Science / Data Analysis.
Maîtrise des outils de data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Connaissances en gestion de bases de données, ETL, intégration de données multisource.
Maîtrise des outils statistiques, notamment R.
Expérience en data science (Python, modélisation prédictive, machine learning).
Capacité à gérer un système d’information et à configurer des sources de données.
Sensibilité aux enjeux d’interopérabilité des systèmes d'information hospitaliers.
Souplesse relationnelle pour collaborer avec des équipes sous forte pression.







Informations complémentaires




Date de début : dès que possible
Lieu : Nyon - Suisse
Durée : Long terme
Langue : Français et anglais
Nationalité européenne requise
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Swarovski, where innovation meets inspiration, our people desire to explore, experience and create. As a Data Scientist you will get a chance to work in a rewarding role within a diverse team that is pushing boundaries. Be part of a truly iconic global brand, learn and grow with us. We’re bold and inventive, revealing astonishing things like no one else can. A world of wonder awaits you.

About The Job

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


Designing and developing quantitative and generative AI assets by translating business problems and requirements into actionable insights
Partnering with other Business Functions to align with market state-of-the-art solutions and identify Advanced Analytics opportunities to be embedded the existing processes
Developing data science products ensuring business improvements are impactful and aligned to the company objectives and strategy, including appropriate and structured documentation of the methodology and data used
Leverage the Data Lake information and cloud infrastructure as well as the current technology landscape to design the solutions
Selecting features, building and optimizing models using Machine Learning and other Advanced Analytics techniques
Coordinating with the Innovation reference people to identify suitable processes for AI agents, analyze them and develop AI Agents use cases
Presenting results and insights to business and driving the conversation about innovation directions in the Advanced Analytics space


About You

We are looking for a unique and amazing talent, who brings along the following:


University degree/ Education, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics or similar
Minimum 3 years of professional experience in a similar role within an international setting
Proficiency in Python and/or R, modelling & real-time analytics, database languages (e.g., SQL), big data frameworks, and Cloud platforms (e.g. Google Cloud Platform, Azure, AWS)
Deep understanding of Generative AI models their implementation in business settings
Previous experience with AI Agents (e.g. GCP Agent builder) is a plus
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Team orientation and ability to work and interface effectively with all levels of the organization
Excellent English proficiency, presentation and communication skills


What We Offer

You can expect a range of benefits, including:


Swarovski products discounts
Full coverage of accident insurance
Attractive pension fund conditions
Subsidized public transportation or free parking
Employee canteen with buffet


Masters of Light Since 1895

Swarovski creates beautiful crystal-based products of impeccable quality and craftsmanship that bring joy and celebrate individuality.

Founded in 1895 in Austria, the company designs, manufactures and sells the world's finest crystal, gemstones, Swarovski Created Diamonds and zirconia, jewelry, and accessories, as well as crystal objects and home accessories. Swarovski Crystal Business has a global reach with approximately 2,400 stores and 6,700 points of sales in around 140 countries and employs more than 18,000 people. Together with its sister companies Swarovski Optik (optical devices) and Tyrolit (abrasives), Swarovski Crystal Business forms the Swarovski Group. A responsible relationship with people and the planet is part of Swarovski’s heritage. Today this legacy is rooted in sustainability measures across the value chain, with an emphasis on circular innovation, championing diversity, inclusion and self-expression, and in the philanthropic work of the Swarovski Foundation, which supports charitable organizations bringing positive environmental and social impact.

Swarovski is an equal opportunity employer. We give our people the guts to celebrate individuality and pride ourselves on creating a workplace where people feel involved, respected, valued, connected, and heard. A place where anyone/everyone belongs. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under the law of the countries we operate in.


Show more

Masters of Light Since 1895

Swarovski creates beautiful crystal-based products of impeccable quality and craftsmanship that bring joy and celebrate individuality.

Founded in 1895 in Austria, the company designs, manufactures and sells the world's finest crystal, gemstones, Swarovski Created Diamonds and zirconia, jewelry, and accessories, as well as crystal objects and home accessories. Swarovski Crystal Business has a global reach with approximately 2,400 stores and 6,700 points of sales in around 140 countries and employs more than 18,000 people. Together with its sister companies Swarovski Optik (optical devices) and Tyrolit (abrasives), Swarovski Crystal Business forms the Swarovski Group. A responsible relationship with people and the planet is part of Swarovski’s heritage. Today this legacy is rooted in sustainability measures across the value chain, with an emphasis on circular innovation, championing diversity, inclusion and self-expression, and in the philanthropic work of the Swarovski Foundation, which supports charitable organizations bringing positive environmental and social impact.

Swarovski is an equal opportunity employer. We give our people the guts to celebrate individuality and pride ourselves on creating a workplace where people feel involved, respected, valued, connected, and heard. A place where anyone/everyone belongs. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under the law of the countries we operate in.

Title: Optimization Data Scientist
Description:
Contexte et environnement

Your mission

As part of the Optimization Services team, you will design, develop, deploy and support the Data Science models of the team’s systems/applications.

The Optimization Services team focuses on the multi-market multi-asset optimizations of short-term power trading. We are part of the Gas & Power IT department for the Trading business lines of the TotalEnergies company, whose main office is in Geneva with a presence on other continents (Singapore, Houston, Dubaï, etc.).

TotalEnergies Gas & Power Trading (TGP) and its affiliates has a large and complex systems environment, which is evolving with the expansion of the power trading business and its impact on trading IT. To accompany these evolutions, the Optimization Services team participates in a significant change program that will have notable impacts both on the short-term and the long-term. In this context, the team is leveraging Data Science and Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP.

This role is global and focuses on the tools used by the front office and the integration into the overall energy management systems. The continuation of the systems performance, availability, and resilience, as well as scalability, need to be assured.

Activités

What You Will Do

Your focus will be on the Data Science models of the Optimization Service’s team applications. A significant part of these models will be based on Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP. You will interact mainly with the team’s Business Analysts, Data Scientists and Back-end Developers.

Analyze:


Understand the business context and specifications
Analyze the technical and functional feasibility
Participate in the design authority processes



Produce:


Design, develop and deploy new functionalities according to business needs
Ensure the proper functioning of the deliverable through monitoring and testing
Ensure the models are seamlessly integrated in the related applications
Implement the adequate balance between model precision and computation complexity
Adjust the deliverables based on feedback
Ensure adherence to best practice, guidelines and procedures for development, test and deployment
Maintain compliance of development and related activities with audit, cybersecurity and other internal requirements



Run & Change:


Improve the existing applications based on business needs and priorities
Participate in the support of the existing applications



Communicate:


Collaborate with Back-end Developers to integrate features and ensure interoperability
Provide technical support and assistance to Business Analysts and other contributors for specifications, testing and the resolution of incidents / problems
Document the codes as well as the algorithms to facilitate maintenance and knowledge transfer
Ensure and maintain effective interactions with other relevant teams
Contribute to the community of Data Scientists



Profil du candidat

We expect you to have:


A Data Scientist / Optimization Expert background with a proficiency in software development
Knowledge and experience in Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP
Proficiency in Python and its good practices
Interest for the power trading business
An ability to quickly understand the physical mechanisms for power assets (e.g.: how a battery works)
Educated to at least Masters degree level or an equivalent in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar discipline



It would be a plus if you had:


Knowledge of data and analytics, including AI/ML technologies, and their application for the power trading business
Experience in Agile methodologies and project management methodologies
Experience in a power utility or trading environment
Good skills on DevOps (Docker, Git, GitHub Actions)
Good knowledge of noSQL databases (MongoDB)
Experience with Databricks
Experience in Cloud-based environments



Your strengths

You are…


Able to solve complex problems
Rigorous
A Team player
Curious and open-minded
Dynamic and agile
Able to shift from detail-oriented to big-picture views



Languages


English : C1 level as minimum expectation
Competency in French is advantageous



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Research Engineer
Description:
At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, execute large scale transformations and implement AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations . Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Requirements

You will collaborate closely with researchers and engineers to implement and optimize systems that support the development and deployment of state-of-the-art AI solutions. This role is ideal for individuals who thrive at the intersection of research and engineering, particularly in building robust tooling and data pipelines for large-scale AI models such as LLMs.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Engineering: Build and maintain robust data pipelines that handle diverse and large-scale datasets, ensuring data quality and accessibility for model training
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, ML engineers, and product managers, to integrate AI solutions into real-world applications
Research Support: Support Data Science needs, run large-scale model training, and analyze results to support ongoing research initiatives


Tooling and Automation: Develop tools and automation scripts to streamline workflows, improve efficiency, and ensure reproducibility in research and development processes.

Requirements

You bring technical strength, curiosity, and a drive to build meaningful AI systems. Here's what helps you succeed in this role:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. A Ph.D. is a plus
Proficiency in Python
Solid understanding of machine learning concepts and experience working with ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX
Experience with large language models (LLMs) and understanding of their training and deployment challenges
Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment of ML models
Experience in deploying distributed systems, cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure), and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
Strong skills in data processing, ETL pipelines, and working with large-scale datasets
Ability to tackle complex problems, think critically, and develop innovative solutions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences


We know that great candidates might not check every box. If you're excited about this role and believe you could contribute, we'd love to hear from you.

Benefits

What we offer


A competitive compensation package
A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth
An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset


Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Career Area

Technology, Digital and Data

Job Description

Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

Who is CAT Digital? What do we do?

Big machines require big thinking. Are you looking for your next big challenge?

Cat® Digital is the digital and technology arm of Caterpillar Inc., leveraging the latest technologies to build industry leading digital solutions for our customers and dealers. With over one million connected assets worldwide, our teams use data, technology, advanced analytics, telematics, and AI capabilities to help our customers build a better world.

Working with a Fortune 100 leader, you can build your career on a global scale and take advantage of development opportunities with emerging technologies. We’ve created an inclusive environment for you to explore your passions, make an impact and do the work that really matters. Join Us.

Job Opportunity

We are seeking talented individuals to join our team to help us grow our presence, organization, culture, which will drive our digital product development efforts. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with top professionals working on very high impact and visibility products. Don't miss this chance to join a forming presence and support digital innovation for a global leader in heavy machinery!

What will you do?

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on analytical tasks and projects on huge amounts of data to support data-driven business decisions and development. You will be a part of the team that utilizes data science and statistical analysis to gain insight into asset condition monitoring as well as market and customer behaviors to support aftermarket businesses.

Your Responsibility Will Involve Understanding Existing Data Pipelines And Algorithms To Provide Technical And Business Support, With The Goal To Enhance And Optimize Them With New Techniques And Models. You Will As Well


Assist the implementation of next-generation techniques (such as weak learning, time series, NLP, genAI…), including tests, validation and delivery
Explore and implement innovative and advanced statistical approaches to improve and transform solutions
Provide support to technical partners as well as business partners to drive adoption
Create documentation, compelling presentations and visualisations to explain complex technical algorithms and impacts into understandable business language


What You Have


Bachelor/Master or PhD degree (statistics, mathematics, physics, economics, biology or a similar field)
Relevant professional experience utilizing quantitative analysis is an advantage
Data visualization tool such as Tableau, PowerBI, Streamlit
Solid background in using SQL and Python, knowledge of advanced statistical models and methods, as well as curiosity to explore and learn more.
Knowledge of data-science operationalization (Airflow, Great Expectations, etc.) is an advantage
Ability to clearly communicate complex technical ideas, regardless of the technical capacity of the audience.


We are looking for someone who can work independently as well as part of a team, who can communicate effectively and efficiently with business partners, and is willing to take ownership of their work. If you have a passion for problem-solving and are constantly looking for ways to optimize processes, we encourage you to apply for this role.

What We Offer

From day one, you’re set up to thrive at Caterpillar: helpful training, relatable mentors, global experience, competitive salary package, work-life balance, and the growth opportunities you expect with a Fortune 100 company. You power our success, and we are committed to empowering yours. After all, when your work can impact the entire world, it’s important to do work that matters.

Additional Information


The position has fixed-term contract (12 months)
A valid Swiss work permit or Swiss or EU-25/EFTA citizenship is required for this position.
There is no relocation and no Visa sponsorship


We value authenticity and encourage candidates to submit original, personally crafted responses throughout our hiring process. Use of AI-generated content may disadvantage your application.

Please frequently check the email associated with your application, including the junk/spam folder, as this is the primary correspondence method. If you wish to know the status of your application – please use the candidate log-in on our career website as it will reflect any updates to your status.

Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Caterpillar is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. For more information, visit https://www.caterpillar.com/en/careers/why-caterpillar.html

Follow us on Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube.



Posting Dates

Caterpillar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants of any age are encouraged to apply

Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Community.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect
Description:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect is responsible for building, deploying, and scaling advanced machine learning (ML) and optimization models on AWS to solve high-impact business problems in supply chain management. This role requires someone with a deep understanding of cloud-based technologies, capable of enhancing existing code and improving model performance. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, enhance existing cloud-based pipelines, and ensure smooth operation of production models. Additionally, you will contribute to automating KPI reports and support data-driven decision-making across the business.




RESPONSIBILITIES

Advanced Data Science Models: Apply statistical and machine learning models to supply chain management, with a focus on improving cost-efficiency and customer satisfaction.
AI & ML Systems: Develop and deploy AI/ML systems for process optimization, such as scheduling problems, and simulate various delivery scenarios.
Cloud-Based Enhancements: Enhance existing cloud-based data science solutions, implement new ML algorithms, and perform rigorous benchmarking to improve performance.
AWS Cloud Integration: Work with AWS cloud tools (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, etc.) to develop and deploy scalable AI/ML pipelines.
Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and visualize data to derive actionable business insights and improve workflows.
KPI Automation: Design, prepare, and automate KPI reports to support strategic decision-making.
Monitoring & Validation: Write test and validation scripts to monitor cloud performance, data latency, and ensure data output quality.
Collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, engineering teams, and business stakeholders to align solutions with operational and business goals.
Documentation: Ensure comprehensive documentation of data processes, modeling strategies, and system designs to facilitate knowledge transfer and system maintainability.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, AI, and cloud technologies to continuously improve the organization's analytical capabilities.




PROFILE




Education:

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

5+ years of hands-on experience in data science, AI/ML.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
Advanced experience with machine learning libraries.
Deep knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and optimization methods.
Experience with AWS technologies (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, Glue, Athena, etc.).
Experience working on optimization and scheduling (Python libraries preferred).
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
Knowledge of CI/CD practices for data workflows.
Experience in supply chain management.
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code.

Travel Requirements:

Occasional travel may be required for business needs.
Show more
HTML:
JOB OVERVIEW

The Senior Data Scientist - ConcreteDirect is responsible for building, deploying, and scaling advanced machine learning (ML) and optimization models on AWS to solve high-impact business problems in supply chain management. This role requires someone with a deep understanding of cloud-based technologies, capable of enhancing existing code and improving model performance. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, enhance existing cloud-based pipelines, and ensure smooth operation of production models. Additionally, you will contribute to automating KPI reports and support data-driven decision-making across the business.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Advanced Data Science Models: Apply statistical and machine learning models to supply chain management, with a focus on improving cost-efficiency and customer satisfaction.
  • AI & ML Systems: Develop and deploy AI/ML systems for process optimization, such as scheduling problems, and simulate various delivery scenarios.
  • Cloud-Based Enhancements: Enhance existing cloud-based data science solutions, implement new ML algorithms, and perform rigorous benchmarking to improve performance.
  • AWS Cloud Integration: Work with AWS cloud tools (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, etc.) to develop and deploy scalable AI/ML pipelines.
  • Data Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and visualize data to derive actionable business insights and improve workflows.
  • KPI Automation: Design, prepare, and automate KPI reports to support strategic decision-making.
  • Monitoring & Validation: Write test and validation scripts to monitor cloud performance, data latency, and ensure data output quality.
  • Collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, engineering teams, and business stakeholders to align solutions with operational and business goals.
  • Documentation: Ensure comprehensive documentation of data processes, modeling strategies, and system designs to facilitate knowledge transfer and system maintainability.
  • Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science, AI, and cloud technologies to continuously improve the organization's analytical capabilities.


PROFILE


Education:

  • Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field (Ph.D. preferred).

Work Experience:

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience in data science, AI/ML.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
  • Advanced experience with machine learning libraries.
  • Deep knowledge of statistical analysis, machine learning techniques, and optimization methods.
  • Experience with AWS technologies (Lambda, API Gateway, SageMaker, Glue, Athena, etc.).
  • Experience working on optimization and scheduling (Python libraries preferred).
  • Excellent problem-solving, communication, and presentation skills.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD practices for data workflows.
  • Experience in supply chain management.
  • Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code.

Travel Requirements:

  • Occasional travel may be required for business needs.

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a Data Scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

In this role, you will be responsible for working on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real-world problems. You will develop high-quality data science products and solutions for clients as well as assets for our internal data teams, focusing on modeling and working alongside the Data Engineering team. Additionally, you will present findings, recommendations, and provide consultation to stakeholders, both internal and clients.

Throughout your tenure, you will learn to work across various industries and sectors, gaining insights into diverse business challenges and applications of data science. You will build large-scale data and analytics solutions, handling complex problems and advanced client situations. You will also learn best practices in data and analytics development, including framework, responsibility model, high-quality code, data security, sustainability, and scalability. Working in collaborative teams with diverse skill sets, you will foster effective teamwork and learn from colleagues in a multicultural and creative environment. Staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science tools, techniques, and technologies, as well as participating in first-class learning programs, will be a key part of your development. You will also develop strong client-facing skills, including effective communication, problem-solving, and presentation abilities.

You will work with other data scientists, data/ML engineers, designers, project managers, and business subject matter experts on interdisciplinary projects across various industry sectors to enable business ambitions with data and analytics.

In terms of who you are, you are a highly collaborative individual capable of setting aside your own agenda to listen to and learn from colleagues. You challenge thoughtfully and prioritize impact. You constantly seek ways to improve and work collaboratively with others. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning, and improving to move forward quickly.

Our tech stack is diverse. While we advocate for using the right tools for the right task, we also take into account the client’s current landscape and preferences. Often, we use Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Databricks, SQL, Docker, and Kubernetes. We also leverage our own proprietary tools such as Kedro, CausalNex, and MLRun. We work on a regular basis with cloud service providers such as AWS, GCP, and Azure.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in (business) math, statistics, machine learning, data science, physics, computer science or engineering required
Master's degree or PhD level in the field of data science, computer science, business informatics or equivalent is a plus
Up to 2 years of professional hands-on experience in applying advanced data science methods and implementing technical data solutions (e.g. develop machine learning models), in order to solve business problems
A strong grasp of various analytics landscape, including business intelligence, machine learning, AI, and generative AI, and how to apply them effectively in different scenarios
Proficiency in Python, SQL (focus on data & analytics applications)
Professional experience in cloud-based analytical tools from market-leading providers such as AWS, MS Azure, Google Cloud
Proficient communication skills in German and English
Effective communication and presentation skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner adapted to different groups of non-technical audiences e.g. business managers, heads of products, sales & marketing leads
Practical experience in generative AI application development
Proven record of advisory works
Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
Show more

Title: Autonomy Engineer - AI & ML
Description:
Do you want to dive into the fast-growing industry of drones and get a rewarding experience in a dynamic start-up environment?




At Flyability, we believe that robots should be sent into hazardous places and dangerous situations instead of humans. To support our belief, we created Elios, the world's first collision-tolerant flying robot that for the first time allows remote entry to complex and indoor spaces. With more than 100 employees, Flyability is the pioneer in the UAV indoor inspection industry. Joining Flyability is not just taking on a new job, it is seizing the opportunity to improve the life of millions of people and build the future of robotics.




To complete our creative and dynamic team in Lausanne, we are seeking an:

Autonomy Engineer - AI & ML

Starting date: as soon as possible




Your role:

You will lead the data-driven side of our AI development, shaping how we collect, label, and use data to train models that generalize in real-world conditions. Beyond data, you will contribute to model selection, evaluation, and integration, helping ensure these models connect meaningfully with our autonomy systems.

This role involves close collaboration with our teams to develop and maintain the interfaces and logic required to execute complex robotic tasks.




What you will own:

Design and implementation of training pipelines, including dataset structuring, labeling strategies, and simulation integration
Specialization and adaptation of foundation models, including large language models (LLMs), using techniques like fine-tuning, RAG, and vector database integration
Development of robust evaluation pipelines for both conventional models and LLMs, including stratified test sets, error analysis, and performance tracking
Integration of trained models into execution pipelines in collaboration with our other teams




Requirements




Your profile:

3+ years of experience training and tuning deep learning models on real or simulated data
Solid understanding of how data quality, diversity, and labeling influence model behavior and generalization
Experience analyzing training dynamics, debugging performance issues, and tuning hyperparameters
Proficient in Python and modern ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Experience integrating ML models into larger systems or pipelines, ideally in robotics or embedded contexts




Flyability is a young Swiss company that values independent thinking combined with a collaborative spirit. Every day, you will have the opportunity to share your ideas and contribute to solving problems. We all work together, and each voice is important to move forward.




We know the confidence gap and impostor syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply - regardless of your past experience or resume, we'd love to hear from you.

Show more

Title: Data Science Expert - Formulation & digital transformation
Description:
Be the backbone of innovation and join a leading pharmaceutical company to help keep life-changing science moving forward!

Proclinical is seeking a Data Science Expert - Formulation & digital transformation to support digital transformation initiatives in the development of innovative solid drug delivery platforms. This role bridges formulation workflow optimization with data and digital projects, offering an exciting opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge advancements in pharmaceutical manufacturing. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to refine data handling methodologies, develop robust data strategies, and ensure adherence to best practices and standards.

Please note that to be considered for this role you must have the right to work in this location or hold an EU passport.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with formulation and manufacturing experts to design effective data strategies for unit operations.
Support digital transformation projects by implementing advanced, data-centric approaches.
Contribute to the development of guidelines for data handling, ensuring compliance with standards and procedures.
Liaise with manufacturing site teams, system owners, and business process owners to manage data effectively.
Collect and summarize user feedback on data applications to improve data handling processes.
Compile and visualize experimental data, contributing to comprehensive development reports.
Review development and manufacturing documents, performing thorough data integrity checks.
Promote a culture of learning and collaboration by sharing best practices across digitalization projects.

Key Skills and Requirements:

Advanced degree (Master's or equivalent) in a relevant scientific field.
Proficiency in structuring, wrangling, and engineering data.
Experience with manufacturing processes for pharmaceutical oral dosage forms.
Strong interdisciplinary thinking and ability to collaborate across functions.
Excellent communication and technical writing skills.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

If you are having difficulty in applying or if you have any questions, please contact Ashley Bennett at a.bennett@proclinical.com.



Apply Now:

If you are interested in applying to this exciting opportunity, then please click 'Apply' or to speak to one of our specialists please request a call back at the top of this page.

Proclinical is a leading life sciences recruiter focused on finding exceptional people and matching them with the finest positions across the globe. Proclinical is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

By submitting this application, you confirm that you've read and understood our privacy policy, which informs you how we process and safeguard your data - https://www.proclinical.com/privacy-policy

Title: Machine Learning Data Scientist Intern
Description:
Be a part of a revolutionary change!

Times are changing at PMI. We’ve chosen to do something big. The world expects us to act responsibly. And we are doing just that by transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future.

This transformation will revolutionize every area of our business. The products we sell. Where we sell them. How they’re manufactured and delivered. The way we talk to our customers and engage with society.

It’s the perfect setting place to start your career. As you take your first steps, you’ll have the backing of a multinational business combined with the freedom of a start-up. You’ll bring a positive mindset and fresh perspective to projects that can make a huge difference to so many.

About The Team

The Digital Product Innovation (DPI) team is a specialized group within IT and R&D focused on driving innovation in connected embedded devices. DPI provides digital leadership from ideation to product brief, supporting rapid prototyping, user testing, and early-stage validation. The team leverages advanced technologies—including AI and machine learning—to enhance the entire product lifecycle, from R&D to mass production.

Internship Description

We are seeking a motivated and curious intern to join our Technology Innovation team for a hands-on project that explores the full spectrum of modern machine learning—from embedded systems to cutting-edge transformer models and large language models (LLMs).

What You’ll Work On

Design and implement machine learning algorithms across a range of platforms, from lightweight embedded devices to scalable transformer-based architectures.

Analyze and extract insights from large-scale data lakes, applying statistical and ML techniques to real-world datasets.

Develop and deploy models using Python and standard libraries such as scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, and PyTorch or TensorFlow.

Leverage cloud technologies for data processing, model training, and deployment pipelines.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to prototype and validate innovative solutions that support our digital product roadmap.

What We’re Looking For


Background in computer science, data science, electrical engineering, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with ML libraries.
Interest in both low-level embedded systems and high-level AI models.
Experience or coursework in cloud computing and data engineering is a plus.
A passion for learning, experimenting, and solving complex problems.


Roles & Objectives

As a Machine Learning Intern, you will play a key role in a forward-looking project that spans the full spectrum of AI—from embedded ML to large-scale transformer models and LLMs. You’ll be part of a dynamic team that values experimentation, rapid iteration, and real-world impact.

Key Responsibilities


Model Development: Design, train, and evaluate machine learning models using Python and libraries such as scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.
Data Engineering: Work with large-scale data lakes to clean, transform, and analyze structured and unstructured data.
Advanced AI: Experiment with transformer architectures and LLMs to solve complex problems and extract insights from large datasets.
Cloud Integration: Use cloud platforms to build scalable pipelines for data processing, model training, and deployment.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and innovation leads to align technical solutions with business needs.


The student would be expected to work independently, think critically, and possess strong problem-solving skills. They would also be expected to communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders.

Who We’re Looking For

We seek an enthusiastic student who embodies curiosity, creativity, and technical prowess. Here’s the ideal candidate:


Enrolled or just finished a degree program in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Solid Python skills and experience with libraries like scikit-learn, pandas, and NumPy.
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
Interest in both embedded ML and large-scale models like transformers or LLMs.
Independence and Critical Thinking: You’ll have the autonomy to explore, innovate, and solve complex problems.
Effective Communication: Collaborate seamlessly with team members and stakeholders.


What We Offer

Hands-On Experience: The student will gain practical experience in their field of study, contributing to their professional growth.


Skill Enhancement: Opportunities to learn and apply new skills, including exposure to real-world scenarios.
Networking and Mentorship: Interaction with experienced professionals within the organization.
Flexible Work Environment: A supportive work environment that respects academic commitments.
Project Exposure: Involvement in projects that contribute to the organization’s goals.


Our success depends on our talented employees who come to work here every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress.

Join PMI And You Too Can

Seize the freedom to shape your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.

Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.

Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business –our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.

Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.

PMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

6086
Show more

Our success depends on our talented employees who come to work here every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress.

Join PMI And You Too Can

Seize the freedom to shape your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.

Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.

Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business –our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.

Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.

PMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

6086

Title: Sr. Data Scientist (M/W)
Description:
Our mission for 30 years? Be there at the right time!

Our expertise? Helping our clients capture the user's attention and transform this fleeting interaction into a memorable one. With this in mind, we support companies in implementing and managing digital solutions for a reinvented user experience.

What does the right interaction mean? It's capturing our attention at the right time, in the right place, and converting it into desire and trust. A subtle balance between too much and too little. Between too early and too late.

Become an SQLian and be part of this great adventure within a company on a human scale, but with big ambitions. We are more than 2,200 talented people in over 13 countries and 3 continents.





Our culture?

Dare and create.





Job Description



We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist with good business acumen to join our Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) team. This role will work in close collaboration with our CRM and Marketing teams to drive customer insights, sales prediction, and campaign performance forecasting. The ideal candidate is highly analytical, comfortable with large data sets, and capable of transforming complex information into strategic recommendations that directly support business growth.



Key Responsibilities:



Partner with the CRM team to extract and analyze customer insights and behavioral data



Conduct data analysis across all D2C business domains to support strategic decision-making



Build predictive models to forecast sales performance based on CRM insights and consumer behavior



Develop forecasts and performance tracking models for marketing campaigns, providing actionable recommendations



Design and implement statistical models and methodologies to support segmentation, targeting, and customer lifecycle analysis



Perform data modeling, transformation, and cleansing to ensure high data quality and readiness for analysis



Write complex queries to extract, aggregate, and manipulate data from various sources



Present findings in a clear, compelling manner to stakeholders across marketing, sales, and CRM teams



Support experimentation (A/B testing, lift studies) and campaign measurement with solid analytical frameworks





Qualifications


Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field
8+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related quantitative role, preferably in a D2C or consumer-focused environment
Proven experience building predictive models and performing statistical analysis using tools such as Python, R, or similar
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and aggregation
Strong understanding of CRM systems, customer behavior analytics, and marketing data.
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly and effectively to non-technical stakeholders
Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to data quality and accuracy
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or similar) is a plus


Additional Information


A human-sized agency (150 employees) close to its clients: you work in our offices or at our clients' sites as part of a team
Career support with HR standards: annual review, training, assignment monitoring, etc.
A friendly and dynamic work environment

Want to know more? Send us your application.



This role is Zürich-based.

Title: Internship ML Engineering
Description:
VA is growing, and searching for an ML Engineer intern to join us in Lugano for a 3 months / 6 months period




Tasks:

Prototype, engineer and deliver Machine Learning pipelines (mostly Computer Vision and Large Language Models)
Train and test Reinforcement Learning agents and environments
Study and integrate Computer Vision Models and Large Language Models in RL agents




Requirements:

EU/CH Citizenship
Able to start from the beginning / mid October in Lugano, Switzerland
Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Machine Learning, or equivalent background
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with modern ML tools. Experience with deep learning libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow/ONNX,...) and Scientific computing libraries (NumPy, SciPy,...)
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Strong command of the English and Italian language
Work experience is a plus
Any type of experience with game design platforms such as Unity, Unreal Engine or Godot is a plus




We offer:

Paid internship contract for 3 to 6 months (upon argeement)
Participation in cutting-edge R&D projects
Possibility to participate in research projects and article publications
An international working environment and a flexible working model

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior Machine Learning Engineer – Zurich




Join a global product company delivering AI-powered solutions to over 1,500 banks in more than 80 countries. We’re seeking a senior, hands-on ML Engineer with a strong software engineering foundation to lead a small team in designing, building, and deploying AI at the core of the product.




You’ll work within a Java + Kubernetes ecosystem, collaborating closely with engineering and product teams to deliver new features in a secure, scalable way. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of machine learning, enterprise-grade software engineering, and leadership.




What you’ll bring:

Strong software engineering skills, with experience in Kubernetes environments
Proven track record of building and deploying ML models in production
Familiarity with LLMs and real-world AI applications
Ability to directly work with the CEO in creating new ideas
Bonus: knowledge of Banking based AI - fraud detection (anomaly detection), anti-money laundering (AML), and KYC (Name screening)
Fluent in English, based in Zurich (2 days a week in office)




Offer:

Salary: 150,000 – 160,000 CHF
Work on mission-critical AI solutions for global banking clients
Collaborative, international team environment

We’re growing our team in Lugano and looking for a talented AI Engineer. Experience with multi-agent simulations is highly valued, and knowledge of multi-agent reinforcement learning and LLMs is a strong plus. If this sounds like you, reach out — we’d love to tell you more.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Project Description:

We are looking for an experienced specialist to work for one of our client from the banking industry.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement advanced machine learning and deep learning models tailored to complex financial datasets and business objectives.
Apply statistical and mathematical methods to analyze data trends, assess risk, and inform predictive modeling.
Evaluate, validate, and monitor model performance, ensuring accuracy, stability, and regulatory compliance.
Collaborate with financial analysts, IT teams, and data scientists to align models with operational and strategic goals.
Translate technical results into actionable insights through clear visualizations and communication to non-technical stakeholders.
Stay current on evolving financial regulations, market developments, and innovations in AI applications for the banking sector.




Mandatory Skills Description:

Strong foundation in statistics, probability, and linear algebra, essential for developing interpretable and robust models.
Deep expertise in Python and R, with hands-on experience using libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Pandas.
Solid understanding of financial markets, instruments, and regulatory frameworks, enabling informed model development and deployment.
Proven ability to evaluate and validate models for fairness, accuracy, and real-world relevance.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with experience presenting to business leaders and cross-functional stakeholders.
Experience with deep learning frameworks, NLP, and time-series forecasting in financial contexts is highly desirable.




Languages:

English: C1 Advanced

Title: ML Research Engineer, Lausanne
Description:
Isomorphic Labs is applying frontier AI to help unlock deeper scientific insights, faster breakthroughs, and life-changing medicines with an ambition to solve all disease.

The future is coming. A future enabled and enriched by the incredible power of machine learning. A future in which diseases are curtailed or cured starting with better and faster drug discovery.

Come and be part of an interdisciplinary team driving groundbreaking innovation and play a meaningful role in contributing towards us achieving our ambitious goals, while being a part of an inspiring and collaborative culture.

The world we want tomorrow is the one we’re building today. It starts with the culture at this company. It starts with you.

About Iso

Isomorphic Labs (IsoLabs) was launched in 2021 to advance human health by building on and beyond the Nobel-winning AlphaFold system. Since then, our interdisciplinary team of drug discovery experts and machine learning specialists has built powerful new predictive and generative AI models that accelerate scientific discovery at digital speed.

Our name comes from the belief that there is an underlying symmetry between biology and information science. By harnessing AI’s powerful capabilities, we can use it to model complex biological phenomena to help design novel molecules, anticipate how drugs will perform and develop innovative medicines to treat and cure some of the world’s most devastating diseases.

We have built a world-leading drug design engine comprising AI models that are capable of working across multiple therapeutic areas and drug modalities. We are continually innovating on model architecture and developing cutting-edge capabilities to advance rational drug design.

Every day, and with each new breakthrough, we’re getting closer to the promise of digital biology, and achieving our ambitious mission to one day solve all disease with the help of AI.

Research Engineering (Machine Learning), London or Lausanne

We are looking for Research Engineers with different levels of experience - Mid through to Senior, Staff, Principal or equivalent levels.

Your impact

This is an exciting opportunity for you to contribute to frontier research at the intersection of AI and drug design.

Working in a highly creative, iterative environment, you will be partnering with scientists and engineers to advance foundational models that will transform the biopharmaceutical world as we know it.

You will draw upon your existing engineering and Machine Learning experience whilst learning from those around you, to apply novel techniques and ideas to newly encountered computational biology and chemistry problems.

What You Will Do

Implementation & Optimisation:


Translate research concepts into practical implementations by developing and optimising state-of-the-art AI models, and building and maintaining robust codebases, data pipelines, and infrastructure for training and evaluation.


Experimentation & Evaluation:


Design, implement, and run experiments to evaluate the performance and robustness of ML models, using a full spectrum of state-of-the-art machine learning methods. Evaluating, tuning, and maintaining AI/ML models (which includes collecting and preparing data as needed)


Evaluation and inference:


Implement algorithms and software to analyse and evaluate the performance of AI models.
Optimising performance of AI/ML models such as Diffusion models, Transformers, GNNs, leveraging a deep understanding of the AI/ML hardware+software stack
Advise on how to bring AI/ML models to production and/or integrating them into product offerings, and monitoring and refining their behavior.
Developing specialised tools/frameworks/infrastructure to aid in the work above


Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing:


Work closely with research scientists and engineers, contributing to team discussions, sharing knowledge, and actively participating in code reviews to foster a collaborative environment.


Innovation & Impact:


Proactively identify and address technical challenges, stay updated on the latest AI advancements, and focus on developing solutions that enable scaling our wider foundation and applied model platforms.
Ability to execute on independent engineering projects and software development towards research goals.


Essential

Skills and Qualifications


PhD in technical subject with major engineering component and exposure to AI/ML, or BSc, MSc and 2+ years of specific experience working on ML model development:
Strong general engineering experience, as evidenced by exposure to one or more of:
Software design / algorithms, especially for deep learning frameworks
Modern ML frameworks such as JAX, PyTorch or TensorFlow
Distributed systems and runtimes
Compilers (e.g. XLA, Triton, CUDA, Pallas, …)
Large scale model training and serving infrastructure
Experience in navigating complex research codebases
Databases and data processing pipelines
Numerical methods, simulation, optimisation
Strong fundamentals in mathematics, statistics, linear algebra
Experience with the full ML research and development lifecycle.
Strong understanding of ML theory and applications.
Strong understanding of data structures and algorithms.


Nice to have


Interest in chemistry and biology.
Experience working with biomedical data.
Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry, ideally with a focus on drug discovery.


Culture and values

We are guided by our shared values. It's not about finding people who think and act in the same way. These values help to guide our work and will continue to strengthen it.

Thoughtful

Thoughtful at Iso is about curiosity, creativity and care. It is about good people doing good, rigorous and future-making science every single day.

Brave

Brave at Iso is about fearlessness, but it’s also about initiative and integrity. The scale of the challenge demands nothing less.

Determined

Determined at Iso is the way we pursue our goal. It’s a confidence in our hypothesis, as well as the urgency and agility needed to deliver on it. Because disease won’t wait, so neither should we.

Together

Together at Iso is about connection, collaboration across fields and catalytic relationships. It’s knowing that transformation is a group project, and remembering that what we’re doing will have a real impact on real people everywhere.

Creating An Extraordinary Company

We believe that to be successful we need a team with a range of skills and talents. We're building an environment where collaboration is fundamental, learning is shared and every employee feels supported and able to thrive. We value unique experiences, knowledge, backgrounds, and perspectives, and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Hybrid working

It’s hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you’re in). If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we’d be happy to talk through these if you’re selected for an initial screening call.

Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.

>> Click to view other open roles at Isomorphic Labs
