Title: Research Scientist - Meta
Description:
Meta is seeking a Research Scientist to join its Fundamental AI Research (FAIR) organization, focused on making significant advances in Developmental AI (DevAI). Current machine learning algorithms can match human performance in a variety of tasks but require orders of magnitude more data. DevAI aims at building AI agents that learn autonomously from few amounts of real world data and interactions as children do. This covers the design of algorithms that leverage advanced machine learning techniques to improve robustness and sample efficiency, the building of datasets or simulators of ecological data, and benchmarks to compare how fast children and machines learn given similar input. The focus is on grounded language and communication. We publish groundbreaking papers and release frameworks/libraries that are widely used in the open-source community fostering the advancement of AI at its intersection with the study of natural intelligence. We seek researchers with a mixed expertise in machine learning (speech, language, vision, core ML) and cognitive science (developmental or language science) to join our research team to foster cutting-edge research in Developmental AI.

Research Scientist - Meta Responsibilities:


Publish state-of-the-art research papers in both high impact machine learning and cognitive science outlets
Conduct independent research that investigates how AI can improve the science of learning in biological organisms and vice versa
Open source high quality code and reproducible results for the community


Minimum Qualifications:


Ph.D. and established track record of leading and/or contributing to influential research, e.g. as evidenced by high-impact publications at peer-reviewed AI conferences (e.g. NeurIPS, CVPR, ICML, ICLR, ICCV, ACL, Interspeech and ICASSP)
Documented interest in cross-disciplinary research in topics relevant to developmental AI
Experience communicating research for public audiences of peers, as well as non-technical audiences


Preferred Qualifications:


2+ years of work experience in a faculty, industry, or government research position with primary emphasis on AI research
Experience in developing and debugging in C/C++, Python, PyTorch
Publications in top cognitive (neuro)science journals or conferences (Cognition, Cognitive Science, etc) a plus.
Experience driving original scholarship in collaboration with a team


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Scientist / Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description:
Gestalte die Zukunft der Energiebranche mit der Entwicklung einer umfassenden Datenplattform, innovativen Datenprodukten für die CKW Netze und bringe deine Expertise in unser Team ein!




Pensum: 80-100%




Das kannst du gestalten




Du entwickelst und betreibst unsere Datenplattform.
Du arbeitest an der Verbesserung der Datenqualität in unseren Quellsystemen.
Du setzt komplexe Use Cases in Zusammenarbeit mit Stakeholdern um.
Du bringst Methodenkompetenzen ein (Incident Management, Tool-Set zur Datenanalyse, Usability, Performance).
Du unterstützt das Team bei der Etablierung einer Data Literacy innerhalb der Geschäftsbereichs Netze.




Das macht dich aus




Du hast einen Abschluss in einem technischen Fach, idealerweise Ingenieurswissenschaften.
Du bringst Erfahrungen zu Databricks, Azure, Python und SQL ein.
Dein Interesse gilt nicht nur der Datenanalyse, sondern auch dem Data Engineering (z.B. dem Einbinden von Quellsysteme, Datenmodellierung in einer Data Lakehouse Architektur oder Definition von Stakeholder-Requirements).
Du hattest bereits erste Berührungspunkte mit der Energiebranche.
Du bist kommunikativ und kannst komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich erklären.
Du hast gute Kenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch, sowohl mündlich als auch schriftlich.

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
About the Wyss Center for Bio and Neuroengineering, Geneva, Switzerland

The Wyss Center is an independent not-for-profit translational R&D and venture builder organization focused on advancing disruptive neurotechnologies to transform the lives of people with neurological and mental health disorders. The Center pursues transformational technologies in artificial intelligence, bio- and neuroengineering to restore essential neural functions and deliver precision therapeutics for people with debilitating neurological and mental health disorders.




Based at Campus Biotech in Geneva, Switzerland, the Wyss Center partners with universities, academic health systems, and health-tech companies, in Switzerland and internationally, to drive innovation, build ventures, and maximize clinical impact. The Wyss Center was established by a generous donation from the Swiss entrepreneur and philanthropist Hansjörg Wyss in 2014.




About the position

The Wyss Center is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Research Scientist with expertise in spatial biology (immunostaining, RNA FISH, spatial transcriptomics, and spatial proteomics) and advanced imaging, to work on an interdisciplinary project focused on developing new automated methods for 3D tissue profiling. The successful candidate will work closely with a team of scientists and engineers to establish 3D workflows for spatial profiling of large tissue volumes.




The ideal candidate is highly collaborative, intellectually curious, and adaptable professional with a PhD or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Life Sciences, Bioengineering, Biology, Chemical Biology) with a can-do attitude motivated by technical and scientific challenges. He brings a strong foundation in scientific or technical knowledge, paired with excellent interpersonal and project coordination skills. This role requires working effectively within a matrix organization, engaging with colleagues from cross-functional teams.




They will report directly to the Center’s Director of Neuroimaging.




Key responsibilities

In their position, the Research Scientist will have a broad set of responsibilities which includes:

Establish, implement and optimize novel multiplexed 3D RNA and protein labelling techniques for large tissue volumes.
Plan, execute, and document experiments, including tissue processing, clearing, and spatial multiomic assay.
Perform advanced imaging using confocal and lightsheet microscopy, and contribute to the optimization of imaging pipelines.
Collaborate closely with R&D engineers to transfer manual protocols to automated systems.
Continuously troubleshoot to improve the robustness, reproducibility, and overall performances of protocols.
Provide continuous feedback to guide improvements of the automated platform.
Collect and analyze experimental and imaging data. Present results in regular reports and meetings.
Facilitate effective communication between project partners, ensuring alignment on goals, timelines, and deliverables.




Required competence and experience

PhD in Life Sciences, Bioengineering, Biology, Chemical Biology, or related field, or MSc with 2+ years of experience in relevant role.
Extensive hands-on experience in tissue processing and stainings techniques, including immunofluorescence assays and in situ hybridization assays
Extensive experience in biological and chemical assay optimization and troubleshooting
Strong experience with fluorescence imaging, experience with lightsheet microscopy is a plus
Excellent knowledge of spatial transcriptomics and spatial proteomics technologies.
Experience with large tissue staining and tissue clearing is a plus.
Openness to work with cutting-edge prototypes
Experience in image processing and data analysis is a strong plus.
Ability to work in an independent manner, while contributing effectively to a collaborative team environment
Efficient, flexible, and goal-oriented, with strong organizational and time management skills
Fluency in oral and written English (C1) is a must, French is a plus




Expected start date: 01.12.2025




To apply, please send your CV and covering letter describing your qualifications, background, and interest in this position to HR@wysscenter.ch no later than 31st August 2025.




Easy Apply job applications will not be considered.

Title: Senior Data Scientist & Product Owner
Description:
Swiss Medical Network, un des plus importants réseaux de cliniques privées en Suisse, s’est fixé comme objectif principal d’offrir des soins hospitaliers de première qualité à ses patients suisses et étrangers. Swiss Medical Network se distingue par ses services de qualité, son environnement de travail agréable et son équipe de management entrepreneuriale. Swiss Medical Network regroupe actuellement 21 établissements privés en Suisse, et ceci dans les trois principales régions linguistiques.





Description du poste



Ceci est votre chance de faire partie de notre équipe Data & Analytics et de contribuer à façonner l'avenir de l'analyse des données chez SMN. En collaboration avec vos collègues, vous identifiez et mettez en œuvre des solutions de pointe, durables, axées sur les données et intégrez les systèmes d'information existants de manière flexible. Vous travaillez, main dans la main, avec nos partenaires d’outsourcing et les équipes métiers internes pour offrir à nos clients un service toujours meilleur. L’objectif de l’équipe D&A est de permettre aux utilisateurs une prise de décision rapide et éclairée sur la base des informations d’une multitude de systèmes.



Les nouveaux projets vous inspirent-ils ? Aimez-vous travailler, avec vos collègues, dans un environnement ardu, exigent et difficile ? Si oui, nous aimerions vous rencontrer !





Qualifications



Profil recherché:



Master ou doctorat en informatique, statistique, mathématiques ou dans un domaine connexe.



Au moins 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de la science des données, de préférence dans le secteur de la santé avec expérience hospitalière est un plus.



Solides connaissances en Machine Learning, Deep Learning, méthodes de modélisation statistique et Data Mining.



Expérience avec les technologies Big Data et l'analyse de grands ensembles de données.



Excellentes compétences en leadership et en communication.



Très bonnes connaissances de l'allemand et du français, l'anglais est un atout.



Connaissance du modèle de maturité HIMSS AMAM et expérience dans le développement de stratégies analytiques.



Forte capacité de réflexion analytique, créativité et aptitude à la résolution de problèmes.



Autonomie et orientation vers les résultats.



Connaissance du monde Google Cloud Plateform est un plus.



Vos responsabilités:



Leadership stratégique : Développement et mise en œuvre de la stratégie Data & Analytics en accord avec les objectifs de l'entreprise.



Assurer la gestion du fournisseur principale (contrat, support, nouvelles fonctionnalités...)



Gestion du cycle de vie du produit utilisé pour les analyses



Orientation de l'équipe : Encadrement, coaching et mentorat de l'équipe Data & Analytics, promotion du développement professionnel et personnel des membres de l'équipe.



Gestion de projet : Priorisation, planification, direction et suivi des projets Data Analytics, y compris la gestion du budget, la gestion des risques et la garantie du respect des délais.



Définition du besoin : en collaboration avec nos business analysts, vous challengez les besoins exprimez par les utilisateurs, avez une vision globale et proposez des solutions d’optimisation.



Communication avec les utilisateurs : Communication proactive avec les utilisateurs et les parties prenantes, transmission de concepts techniques complexes de manière compréhensible, recueil et analyse des besoins.



Développement de la maturité Data & Analytics : Analyse cyclique du niveau de maturité actuel des capacités analytiques à l'aide du modèle de maturité HIMSS AMAM, développement et mise en œuvre de mesures pour atteindre le niveau de maturité suivant.



Analyse et interprétation des données : Analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes provenant de différentes sources, extraction d'informations exploitables et formulation de recommandations en collaboration avec les Data Engineers et les Data Analysts.



Veille technologique : Surveillance et évaluation des nouvelles technologies et tendances dans le domaine de l'analyse et de la science des données, identification du potentiel d'innovation pour Swiss Medical Network.



Data & Analytics Self-Service : Mise en place d’un concept de formation et formation continue au sein de l’entreprise pour faire gagner en autonomie et compétences les utilisateurs finaux.









Informations supplémentaires



Nous offrons



Une activité stimulante et variée au sein d'une entreprise dynamique et tournée vers l'avenir.



La possibilité de contribuer activement à l'avenir de l'analyse des données dans le secteur de la santé.



Un salaire attractif et des avantages sociaux complets.



Un environnement de travail moderne et des modèles de travail flexibles.



Des possibilités de développement individuel et des offres de formation continue.



Entrée en fonction



Dès que possible







Lieu de travail



Genève, Lausanne, Sion, Fribourg, Soleure, Bâle ou Zurich (missions / projets dans toute la Suisse)







Candidature



Nous vous invitons à soumettre votre dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation et références) sur notre site web.



Les agences de placement sont priées de s'abstenir.



Seules les candidatures correspondant au profil ci-dessus seront prises en considération.

Show more
HTML:
Swiss Medical Network, un des plus importants réseaux de cliniques privées en Suisse, s’est fixé comme objectif principal d’offrir des soins hospitaliers de première qualité à ses patients suisses et étrangers. Swiss Medical Network se distingue par ses services de qualité, son environnement de travail agréable et son équipe de management entrepreneuriale. Swiss Medical Network regroupe actuellement 21 établissements privés en Suisse, et ceci dans les trois principales régions linguistiques.



Description du poste

Ceci est votre chance de faire partie de notre équipe Data & Analytics et de contribuer à façonner l'avenir de l'analyse des données chez SMN. En collaboration avec vos collègues, vous identifiez et mettez en œuvre des solutions de pointe, durables, axées sur les données et intégrez les systèmes d'information existants de manière flexible. Vous travaillez, main dans la main, avec nos partenaires d’outsourcing et les équipes métiers internes pour offrir à nos clients un service toujours meilleur. L’objectif de l’équipe D&A est de permettre aux utilisateurs une prise de décision rapide et éclairée sur la base des informations d’une multitude de systèmes.

Les nouveaux projets vous inspirent-ils ? Aimez-vous travailler, avec vos collègues, dans un environnement ardu, exigent et difficile ? Si oui, nous aimerions vous rencontrer !



Qualifications

Profil recherché:

  • Master ou doctorat en informatique, statistique, mathématiques ou dans un domaine connexe.

  • Au moins 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de la science des données, de préférence dans le secteur de la santé avec expérience hospitalière est un plus.

  • Solides connaissances en Machine Learning, Deep Learning, méthodes de modélisation statistique et Data Mining.

  • Expérience avec les technologies Big Data et l'analyse de grands ensembles de données.

  • Excellentes compétences en leadership et en communication.

  • Très bonnes connaissances de l'allemand et du français, l'anglais est un atout.

  • Connaissance du modèle de maturité HIMSS AMAM et expérience dans le développement de stratégies analytiques.

  • Forte capacité de réflexion analytique, créativité et aptitude à la résolution de problèmes.

  • Autonomie et orientation vers les résultats.

  • Connaissance du monde Google Cloud Plateform est un plus.

Vos responsabilités:

  • Leadership stratégique : Développement et mise en œuvre de la stratégie Data & Analytics en accord avec les objectifs de l'entreprise.

  • Assurer la gestion du fournisseur principale (contrat, support, nouvelles fonctionnalités...)

  • Gestion du cycle de vie du produit utilisé pour les analyses

  • Orientation de l'équipe : Encadrement, coaching et mentorat de l'équipe Data & Analytics, promotion du développement professionnel et personnel des membres de l'équipe.

  • Gestion de projet : Priorisation, planification, direction et suivi des projets Data Analytics, y compris la gestion du budget, la gestion des risques et la garantie du respect des délais.

  • Définition du besoin : en collaboration avec nos business analysts, vous challengez les besoins exprimez par les utilisateurs, avez une vision globale et proposez des solutions d’optimisation.

  • Communication avec les utilisateurs : Communication proactive avec les utilisateurs et les parties prenantes, transmission de concepts techniques complexes de manière compréhensible, recueil et analyse des besoins.

  • Développement de la maturité Data & Analytics : Analyse cyclique du niveau de maturité actuel des capacités analytiques à l'aide du modèle de maturité HIMSS AMAM, développement et mise en œuvre de mesures pour atteindre le niveau de maturité suivant.

  • Analyse et interprétation des données : Analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes provenant de différentes sources, extraction d'informations exploitables et formulation de recommandations en collaboration avec les Data Engineers et les Data Analysts.

  • Veille technologique : Surveillance et évaluation des nouvelles technologies et tendances dans le domaine de l'analyse et de la science des données, identification du potentiel d'innovation pour Swiss Medical Network.

  • Data & Analytics Self-Service : Mise en place d’un concept de formation et formation continue au sein de l’entreprise pour faire gagner en autonomie et compétences les utilisateurs finaux.





Informations supplémentaires

Nous offrons

  • Une activité stimulante et variée au sein d'une entreprise dynamique et tournée vers l'avenir.

  • La possibilité de contribuer activement à l'avenir de l'analyse des données dans le secteur de la santé.

  • Un salaire attractif et des avantages sociaux complets.

  • Un environnement de travail moderne et des modèles de travail flexibles.

  • Des possibilités de développement individuel et des offres de formation continue.

Entrée en fonction

Dès que possible



Lieu de travail

Genève, Lausanne, Sion, Fribourg, Soleure, Bâle ou Zurich (missions / projets dans toute la Suisse)



Candidature

Nous vous invitons à soumettre votre dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation et références) sur notre site web.

Les agences de placement sont priées de s'abstenir.

Seules les candidatures correspondant au profil ci-dessus seront prises en considération.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Company Description

We are the world’s largest independent energy and commodities trading company. Every day we use our expertise and logistical networks to distribute energy around the world, efficiently and responsibly. From 40 offices worldwide, we seek to add value across the energy supply chain, including deploying our scale and market understanding to help facilitate the energy transition. To date, we have committed over $1 billion of capital to renewable projects, and are identifying and developing low-carbon opportunities around the world.

Our people are our business. Talent is precious to us and we create an environment in which individuals can reach their full potential, unhindered by hierarchy. Our team comprises more than 65 nationalities and we are committed to developing and sustaining a diverse work force. Learn more about us here.

Job Description

As a talented Python Developer, you will help us continue expanding our global analytics platform, fuelled by the rich data generated by our inhouse end-to-end trading system as well as external datasets. We are growing rapidly and are looking for exceptional candidates to help us deliver on our mission. This role will have the opportunity to interface directly with the business, ranging from tank operators to top management to drive our requirements and deliver a wide range of capabilities.

As a member of the analytics team, located in Geneva, Switzerland, you will:


Write modular, reusable components to liaise between external sources of data, internal tools and databases
Be part of a global development team
Maintain the cleanliness and centrality of the Vitol Python codebase
Port legacy code to Python where appropriate
Be able to translate business requirements into a technical delivery following existing patterns where possible


Qualifications


3+ years of enterprise-level coding experience in Python
Experience scraping websites with Beautiful Soup, Selenium, etc.
Oracle / PL SQL development experience including stored procedures
Strong understating of object-oriented design, design patterns, SOA architectures
Proficient understanding of peer-reviewing, code versioning, and bug/issue tracking tools.
Experience working in an agile scrum development model
Takes great pride in the finished project, with a keen eye for detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to drive interactions with project stakeholders
Proactive and user-focused, with a can-do attitude and a genuine interest in the functional as well as technical aspects of each challenge encountered
Drives software development best practices
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and manage changing priorities
Excellent English oral and written skills


Qualifications That Will Help You Stand Out


Familiarity with containerization solutions like Docker and Kubernetes is a plus
Previous experience in the commodities and/or trading industry
University degree (Bachelor or Master) in Computer Science, MIS, or an equivalent field
French language skills an advantage
Show more

Title: Software Engineer (Python/Go)
Description:
Now is an amazing time to join Nozomi Networks as we build the future of OT and IoT cybersecurity.

We defend some of the world’s largest organizations and critical infrastructure in more than 68 countries and we’re just getting started. Our AI-powered cybersecurity platform secures operational technology (OT) and Internet of Things (IoT) infrastructures for enterprises and government entities across energy, manufacturing, transportation, resources, and critical infrastructure.

Nozomi Networks is hiring a Software Engineer to join its expanding team.This is a key position where you'll face technical challenges involving distributed systems, data pipelines, scalability, and architectural design. You will be contributing to overall success in a fast-paced, agile environment.You could be the next "Nozomier"! If this sounds like you, read on.In this role, you will:
Contribute to the design and development of our internal cloud-based infrastructure.
Support internal initiatives as part of an Enabling Team, automating key activities to increase departmental efficiency and enhance overall business impact.
Implement medium to large-scale features, keeping a strong focus on code quality, system maintainability, and technical debt reduction.
Select and use appropriate technologies while showing initiative in learning and adopting new tools as needed.
Take ownership of complex components from design to deployment, including post-release monitoring and iteration.
Support and collaborate proactively with teammates to ensure overall team and project success.
Work in a fast-paced, agile environment where flexibility, communication, and ownership are key.
Embrace and represent the Nozomi Networks cultural values, working with integrity, transparency, and a mission-driven mindset.
To be successful in this role, you will have:
Solid programming experience in Python, Go, or similar languages, with an emphasis on backend development and distributed systems.
Experience with cloud infrastructure, ideally on AWS.
Familiarity with networking protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP) is highly valuable.
Experience with automated testing practices such as TDD or BDD.
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and development workflows (e.g., Scrum, Kanban).
The ability to work in privacy-sensitive and secure environments, with an understanding of data handling best practices.
A collaborative mindset, attention to detail, and the ability to operate effectively in a cross-functional and international team.

Who we are and what we stand for:

Nozomi Networks is the leader in OT and IoT Cybersecurity. We protect the world's critical infrastructure, industrial and government organizations from cyber threats by providing exceptional network visibility, threat detection and operational insight. We’re always innovating and we hire the best at what they do to ensure our customers always have access to fast product enhancements, exceptional engineering support and rapid deployment across continents. If you like a challenge, and value integrity and customer success, we invite you to help Nozomi Networks build the future of OT and IoT cybersecurity.

Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging are part of our core beliefs, at Nozomi Networks. Diversity of thought, background and culture broadens our knowledge of the world and helps us learn, grow, and gain new perspectives. What makes us all different is what makes us powerful.

Our Global Benefits

All of our benefits are customized to the country you are based in, naturally we want to get the best out of our Nozomiers, so we provide the best benefits packages, such as:

Health & Wellness
Financial
Work-Life Balance
Unparalleled Flexible Time-Off

Need to know information

Successful candidates will be subjected to background verification checks.

Be cautious of unsolicited messages, fake email addresses, requests for money and unclear job descriptions. Report suspicious activity to authorities. Our open job opportunities and descriptions are posted on Nozomi Networks' career page. If in any doubt please apply for opportunities on our careers website here.

If you would like to know more about our Privacy Policy, please click here. Any questions about how we process personal information, or if you would like help exercising your privacy rights please contact us using the email provided within the Privacy Policy.

Title: Internship Data Scientist in Zurich (f/m/x)
Description:
Enabler for smaller, more powerful, and more energy-efficient microchips

 

Working for tomorrow today.

Around 80 percent of all microchips worldwide are produced using ZEISS technologies. As the centerpiece of every electronically controlled system, they have become an integral part of our everyday lives – whether in smartphones, smart homes or smart factories. ZEISS is a technology leader in the field of semiconductor manufacturing equipment. With high-precision lithography optics, photomask systems and process control solutions, ZEISS enables the production of ever smaller, increasingly powerful, and more energy-efficient microchips, and thus plays a pivotal role in the age of micro- and nanoelectronics.

Your Role

With us, you have the opportunity to perfectly combine your studies with practical experience while actively contributing to exciting projects. This allows you to gain valuable skills, expand your network, and grow both professionally and personally. For our development department, we are looking for an Intern (f/m/x) in the field of data science to support our activities in data flow management, software development and computational optimization.


Responsibility for the flow of test data from data generation to requirement verification
Test design, architecture and optimization, test equipment specification and evaluation
Fusion of analytical and statistical methods, computational optimization, and machine learning
Creation of Software Documentation and User Manual
Support to production department in the application of the developed software


Your Profile


Currently enrolled in computer or data science, mechanical, mechatronics, robotics, aerospace engineering or a similar field of study
Initial experience in Python, SQL, OpenCV, object-oriented programming, live interfacing with one or more camera sensors
Knowledge in computer vision theory
Team Player, who readily shares their know-how
Curious, open and solution-oriented mindset, ready to learn from others
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with basic proficiency in German


Sounds exciting? Then become part of #teamZEISS and help us shape the future! Please provide your complete application documents (CV, transcript of records, etc.).

Your ZEISS Recruiting Team

Verena Hald
Show more

Title: Study Coaches
Description:
Date: 14 Aug 2025

Location:

Pully, CH

Job ID: 762

School: Collège Champittet

Company: Nord Anglia Education

Who We Are

Collège Champittet, a school of reference in the Lake Geneva region since 1903, offers excellent education to generations of Swiss and foreign students. Its unique spirit revolves around academic performance, multilingualism and values such as respect and trust.

The school is part of the Nord Anglia Education family, the world's leading premium schools’ organisation with 88 schools in 32 countries. In this dynamic environment, both local and international, we invite you to join our team.

Job Description

You will supervise young people from 11 to 18 years old: during studies several evenings a week as of 6pm and during sports and cultural activities on weekends.

You are a student at University, EPFL or Haute Ecole, in science, economics or literature. You are a native speaker of French or English and have a good command of the other language. Russian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese or Arabic are an asset.

Enthusiastic, patient, you have a natural authority and are motivated to impart your knowledge to young people.

You are flexible and integrate easily into a team thanks to your interpersonal skills.

You are of Swiss or European nationality with a valid work permit. You have clean criminal records.

Title: Scientist Spectroscopy and Data Science
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love. That’s what makes us Roche.

Quality Control (QC) Basel/Kaiseraugst consists of approximately 350 employees, organized into 7 departments with subordinate structures. It serves as a central key point for producing high-quality medicines.

The Opportunity

In this role, you will support the PTDA Analytical Development Team in Basel with the evaluation and development of innovative analytical methods. Your main tasks and responsibilities in this position will be:


Introduce, develop, and enhance spectroscopic methods such as benchtop NMR implementation for pharmaceutical Quality Control (QC) for applications in a GMP environment for IPC, DS and DP release and stability testing in Biologics, focusing on excipient/surfactant quantification with high protein backgrounds
Develop and validate analytical procedures for identification and quantitative determinations, support of regulatory submission activities
Foster GMP method development from scratch for biologics (DS/DP/IPC), focusing on excipient/surfactant quantification in complex matrices as part of an international project team including a comprehensive method risk assessments based on experimental results and perform analytical performance experiments (method qualification) demonstrating excellent precision, accuracy, and linearity
Establish initial SOPs for the system and the first method setup, comprehensive documentation, and validation efforts
Develop user management protocols and standardization strategies to simplify user interfaces, as well as methods for routine end-users
Manage key operational aspects of the platform, including defining SSTs and regular testing procedures in alignment with pharmacopeias, negotiating service agreements, and overseeing instrument maintenance
Facilitate smooth and seamless information exchange with clients, other laboratories within and outside QC, and local and global teams. You will participate in cross-functional project teams


Who you are

You are a positive thinking, integral and self-reflective personality with strong teamwork skills. With this in mind, you bring an open and collaborative attitude and mindset that it takes to work successfully within your team and across departments. You trust yourself and others, take responsibility and live an open speak-up culture.


Completed studies (Master's degree) in a scientific field such as Biology, Chemistry, Pharmacy, Biotechnology; a PhD is a plus
Proven practical experience in developing and optimizing NMR methods in a GMP environment
Broad NMR spectroscopy expertise: Benchtop NMR expertise, GMP method implementation, advanced Topspin skills for measurement automation and method development, Small molecule assignments & quantification, protein backbone/side-chain assignments, NMR titration, relaxation and RDC experiments (for structural elucidation), Solution NMR (data acquisition, processing, analysis)
Highly flexible, service-oriented, and customer-focused, with a strong commitment to meeting client needs and providing exceptional support
Capable of working independently, quick to learn, and able to comprehend complex challenges in an industrial setting


Ready to take the next step? We'd love to hear from you. Apply now to explore this exciting opportunity!

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

You trust yourself and others, take responsibility and live an open speak-up culture.

  • Completed studies (Master's degree) in a scientific field such as Biology, Chemistry, Pharmacy, Biotechnology; a PhD is a plus
  • Proven practical experience in developing and optimizing NMR methods in a GMP environment
  • Broad NMR spectroscopy expertise: Benchtop NMR expertise, GMP method implementation, advanced Topspin skills for measurement automation and method development, Small molecule assignments & quantification, protein backbone/side-chain assignments, NMR titration, relaxation and RDC experiments (for structural elucidation), Solution NMR (data acquisition, processing, analysis)
  • Highly flexible, service-oriented, and customer-focused, with a strong commitment to meeting client needs and providing exceptional support
  • Capable of working independently, quick to learn, and able to comprehend complex challenges in an industrial setting

Ready to take the next step? We'd love to hear from you. Apply now to explore this exciting opportunity!

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Robotics Engineer Intern - SLAM & State Estimation
Description:
Do you want to dive into the fast-growing industry of drones and get a rewarding experience in a dynamic start-up environment?

At Flyability, we believe that robots should be sent into hazardous places and dangerous situations instead of humans. To support our belief, we created Elios, the world's first collision-tolerant flying robot that for the first time allows remote entry to complex and indoor spaces. With more than 100 employees, Flyability is the pioneer in the UAV indoor inspection industry. Joining Flyability is not just taking on a new job, it is seizing the opportunity to improve the life of millions of people and build the future of robotics.

To complete our creative and dynamic team in Lausanne, we are seeking a:

Robotics Engineer Intern - SLAM & State Estimation (100%)

Starting date: as soon as possible

Your role:

As an intern in the Autonomy team, you will support the development and evaluation of real-time SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) and state estimation systems for Flyability's inspection drones. Your work will contribute to improving localization and mapping performance in GPS-denied, real-world environments using data from LiDAR, IMU, and cameras.

You will be involved in prototyping, testing, and analyzing algorithms under the guidance of experienced engineers. The internship will give you hands-on exposure to algorithm development, sensor fusion, and system integration, with opportunities to validate your work in real-world field tests.

What you will own:


Contribute to the design and testing of SLAM and state estimation pipelines using LiDAR, IMU, and camera data
Support the development and tuning of sensor fusion algorithms under guidance from the team
Run evaluations in simulation and participate in field tests to analyze system performance
Help identify and debug localization and mapping issues in collaboration with our other teams


Requirements

Your profile:


Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Robotics, Computer Science, or a related engineering field
Solid understanding of robotics fundamentals, such as Kalman filtering, sensor fusion, feature extraction and matching, pose graph optimization, and 3D orientation representations (e.g. quaternions, Euler angles)
Some hands-on experience with SLAM or state estimation systems, either through coursework, projects, or previous internships
Familiarity with LiDAR, IMU, and camera data, and interest in fusing multi-sensor information for localization and mapping
Proficient in C++ and Python, with good software engineering practices
Exposure to ROS1/ROS2 and experience debugging robotic systems is a plus
Curious, motivated, and eager to work in a real-world robotics environment
Fluent in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus


Flyability is a young Swiss company that values independent thinking combined with a collaborative spirit. Every day, you will have the opportunity to share your ideas and contribute to solving problems. We all work together, and each voice is important to move forward.

Ready to join?

We know the confidence gap and impostor syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don't hesitate to apply —regardless of your past experience or resume, we'd love to hear from you.
Show more

Title: (Gen)AI Development Lead (m/f/d) - Banking Solutions
Description:
About SAP Fioneer

At SAP Fioneer, innovation drives everything we do. Spun out from SAP, we combine agility, cutting-edge delivery, and financial services expertise to build the next generation of banking software.

Our mission: Enable banks to achieve speed, scalability, and cost-efficiency through digital innovation, cloud-native technology, and solutions that cover core banking processes end-to-end. With rapid global growth, a lean structure, and a collaborative culture, SAP Fioneer is the place to accelerate your career.

The Role

We are seeking a (Gen)AI Development Lead (m/f/d) to spearhead AI feature development for our banking products. You'll be the central driver of our GenAI strategy—designing, coding, and deploying production-grade features that integrate into our core banking software.

This is a hands-on technical leadership role. You will build prototypes, deliver production-ready code, and define the technical vision for AI within SAP Fioneer. You will also grow and mentor a dedicated AI development team and ensure best practices for scalable, secure AI solutions.

What You'll Do


Lead the technical design, development, and deployment of (Gen)AI-powered features for our banking products
Be part of the complete innovation process for AI capabilities - all the way from rapid prototypes and demos to production-grade solutions that can be deployed at large banks globally
Work closely with core banking solutions and data - enabling AI agents to interact with transaction data, automate business processes, and generate insights as well as recommendations for our banking customers and their clients
Lead and further grow a high-performing AI development team, setting technical direction and mentoring developers
Collaborate with product managers, solution leads, and our customers to ensure AI features meet requirements and deliver tangible business value
Provide architectural and technical guidance to implementation teams, including where AI features touch SAP/ABAP components



Requirements

What You Bring

Technical expertise


7+ years of software development with a track record of delivering AI/ML solutions in production
Deep understanding of LLMs, ML algorithms, deep learning frameworks, and GenAI methods such as RAG
Hands-on experience with LangChain, LangGraph, LlamaIndex or similar frameworks
Strong programming skills (e.g. Python, Java, JavaScript, C++, R)
Cloud-native development experience (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud) with containerization/orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes)
Proven ability to integrate AI into enterprise-grade systems; SAP/ABAP exposure and experience is a strong plus
Experience in leading and scaling development teams
Skilled at translating business requirements into scalable AI architectures


Why Join Us?


Shape the future of AI in banking - Lead the creation of AI capabilities embedded in mission-critical systems
Hands-on innovation - Own the full lifecycle from prototype to production
Team-building impact - Build and mentor a new AI development team from the ground up
Global collaboration - Work with colleagues and clients across continents
Flexibility - Remote-first with occasional travel for high-value interactions



Benefits

We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes occupational pension provisions, support for health and wellbeing, various mobility options like bike leasing and transportation allowances, as well as additional perks such as celebration rewards, meal programs, jubilee recognition, and relocation reimbursement.

Title: Propulsion Test Engineer
Description:
Imagine this... you are a highly skilled and driven Propulsion Test Engineer with a strong background in developing and executing robust testing solutions for UAVs and small aircraft propulsion systems. Destinus is seeking for someone who can take full ownership of test campaigns, from planning and execution to data analysis and reporting, ensuring that our cutting-edge propulsion technologies meet the highest performance and safety standards. With a minimum of two years of experience in testing, data acquisition, and sensor integration, you bring both technical expertise and a proactive, hands-on approach to problem-solving, driving continuous improvements and delivering reliable, high-quality test results.

At Destinus, we are revolutionizing the defense industry with cutting-edge Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs). Our innovative technologies are designed to meet the unique demands of modern defense operations, delivering unparalleled speed, precision, and cost effectiveness. Destinus partners with government agencies and defense organizations worldwide to provide advanced solutions for mission-critical operations, enabling a new era of efficiency and technological superiority. Join us in shaping the future of defense with groundbreaking aerospace innovations.


What You Will Do

Develop and implement data acquisition systems, ensuring accurate and reliable measurements of critical parameters such as pressure, temperature, thrust, and flow rates
Define sensor requirements, select appropriate instrumentation, and integrate them into test setups while ensuring proper calibration and validation
Independently plan, design, and execute test campaigns for propulsion systems, including static fire tests, sensor validation, and performance characterization
Develop and implement safety, contingency and emergency procedures for all testing activity  
Deliver technical documentation, including test procedures, data analysis reports, and justifications for measurement methodologies
Support the development of test rigs, infrastructure, and safety systems to facilitate efficient and repeatable testing
Participate in design reviews and technical discussions, providing input on testability and data collection strategies
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including mechanical, electrical, software, and systems engineers, to ensure seamless integration of test setups and accurate evaluation of propulsion system performance




Requirements



What You´ll Need

BSc. or MSc. in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related discipline
Min. 2 years of experience in engineering with a focus on testing, data acquisition, and sensor integration
Min. 2 years of experience in test execution, including setup, calibration, and troubleshooting of instrumentation
Hands-on experience with Testing and Safety as well as DAQ systems, instrumentation (pressure sensors, thermocouples, flow meters), and test automation
Ideally, experience in several different phases - test planning, setup design, integration, execution, and data analysis
Good communication skills, proactive attitude, and problem-solving skills
The ability to work to strict timescales as part of an integrated, multidisciplinary team and autonomously
The ability and willingness to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing work environment
Fluency in English language is required. German is a plus



Who You Are 

You are a proactive and detail-oriented Propulsion Test Engineer with a passion for aerospace innovation. With a solid foundation in testing, data acquisition, and sensor integration, you thrive in fast-paced, high-tech environments where precision and safety are paramount. You are a problem solver who takes ownership of test campaigns, driving them from planning to execution with a commitment to quality and performance. Your ability to adapt, analyze complex data, and collaborate across multidisciplinary teams makes you an essential part of any engineering team focused on cutting-edge propulsion systems for UAVs and small aircraft.



Benefits



Why Join Us?

✨ The Thrill of the Future - Work on cutting-edge projects that redefine aerospace.
✨ Global Innovation Hub - Collaborate with top engineers from all over the world.
✨ Fast-Paced & High-Growth - Experience the rush of working in a rapidly expanding company.
✨ Real Impact - Your work won't be theoretical—it will shape the future of flight.

Destinus is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity in our companies and our teams and do not discriminate based on age, race, religion, color, country of origin, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.

🚀 Destinus - Challenge the limits of time, space, and human potential.

Title: Cientista de Dados Jr
HTML:
Há mais de 90 anos, o Banco Bmg vem construindo uma trajetória de conquistas, onde o cliente é o protagonista.

Somos campeões na oferta de consignado, proporcionando acesso ao crédito com juros mais baixos a milhões de brasileiros. Contamos com agências, franquias e um aplicativo, onde milhões de clientes acessam um mundo de soluções financeiras, na palma da mão. Além disso, possuímos a maior rede de correspondentes bancários do país, contribuindo para o placar de crescimento econômico local e espalhando oportunidades por todo o território nacional.

Aqui no Bmg, nós vestimos a camisa e nos dedicamos para executar cada jogada com excelência, com um jeito todo nosso de ser e de fazer negócios, o Jeito Bmg.

Trabalhamos para promover uma cultura diversa, que busca a equidade, valorizando as diferentes perspectivas. Isso se traduz em Gênero, Religião, Pessoas com Deficiência, LGBTQIAP+, acima dos 50 anos, Etnia e diversidade de experiências, tornando o nosso ambiente mais inclusivo e respeitoso, buscando cada vez mais aumentar a pluralidade dos times.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Responsabilidades e atribuições: 

  • Construir, treinar e otimizar modelos utilizando técnicas de aprendizado de máquina;
  • Fazer gestão, acompanhamento e recalibragem dos modelos já implantados;
  • Gerar insights, ad hoc's e estudos analíticos diversos;
  • Construir segmentações baseadas em algoritmos de clusterização;
  • Busca por novas fontes de dados, além das tradicionais disponíveis e estruturadas;
  • Apresentar resultados de projetos de forma compreensível, sem perda de rigor científico;
  • Auxiliar na expansão da cultura do uso da ciência de dados em outras frentes de negócio.


Requisitos e qualificações

Requisitos e qualificações: 

  • Domínio em linguagem de programação Python e modelagem estatística;
  • Habilidade com banco de dados (SQL, ORACLE, etc), visando a extração, limpeza, tratamento e organização dos dados;
  • Entendimento de técnicas de Modelagem Estatística e Machine Learning;
  • Vivência no desenvolvimento e acompanhamento de modelos preditivos e/ou prescritivos.
  • Ter boa comunicação, proatividade, flexibilidade e foco em resultado também são essenciais para você fazer parte do time de Ciência de Dados.
  • Formação superior completa preferencialmente em áreas de exatas.
  • Disponibilidade para atuação híbrida em São Paulo.


Informações adicionais

Benefícios, saúde e bem-estar

  • Plano de saúde sem mensalidade e Telemedicina;
  • Plano odontológico;
  • Vale Refeição e Alimentação;
  • Seguro de vida;
  • Previdência privada;
  • Remuneração variável anual (bônus) competitiva;
  • PPR - Programa de Participação nos Resultados;
  • Único Skill (Benefício Educação gratuito);
  • Bicicletário e vestiário;
  • Auxílio creche;
  • Auxílio internet;
  • Programas de qualidade de vida;
  • Ambulatório;
  • Programa da Gestante;
  • Licença Maternidade e Paternidade estendidas
  • Psicologia Viva - Sessões de terapia online gratuita;
  • PAP - Programa de assessoria financeira, jurídica e psicológica;
  • Gympass - Desconto em academias;
  • Frutas todos os dias;
  • Day Off de Aniversário;
  • Dress Code Flexível;
  • Modelo híbrido de trabalho.


E aí? Quer vestir a camisa e brilhar em campo com um banco presente na vida de milhões de brasileiros e reconhecido como um dos melhores lugares para se trabalhar?

#VamosPraCima

Title: Data Science Analyst
HTML:
A Daki nasceu para revolucionar o delivery de mercado. O que antes alguém recebia em horas ou dias, agora recebe em minutos!

Mais que entregar rápido, buscamos entregar uma experiência incrível para os nossos clientes. Buscamos aquele "UAU" de quando o cliente recebe muito antes do que esperava.

E tudo começa muito antes da montagem do pedido, na verdade, começa bem aqui.

Responsabilidades e Atribuições

  • Ser referência técnica em ciência de dados dentro da Daki, apoiando times multifuncionais com análises robustas, modelagens preditivas e experimentos bem desenhados;
  • Atuar com protagonismo em projetos estratégicos, como previsão de demanda, recomendação de produtos, otimização de preços e rotas logísticas;
  • Conduzir iniciativas de coleta, organização, e interpretação de grandes volumes de dados, transformando-os em insights acionáveis;
  • Saber transitar entre áreas técnicas e de negócio, comunicando resultados com clareza e garantindo que decisões de produto e estratégia sejam orientadas por dados;
  • Apoiar a evolução da nossa stack de dados e MLOps, colaborando com times de engenharia e plataforma;
  • Trabalhar com soluções e serviços na nuvem, especialmente Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud

Functions, Vertex AI), para escalar análises e modelos preditivos;

  • Atuar proativamente na criação de uma cultura de dados em todos os níveis da empresa.

Requisitos e Qualificações

  • Experiência sólida em projetos de ciência de dados com impacto real em produto ou negócio;
  • Proficiência em Python (pandas, sklearn, etc) e SQL para análise e manipulação de dados;
  • Experiência com modelos de machine learning supervisionado e não supervisionado, e conhecimento de

pipelines de deploy em produção;

  • Familiaridade com experimentos A/B, design de testes e inferência causal;
  • Experiência com ferramentas de visualização como Looker ou similares;
  • Capacidade de traduzir problemas de negócio em soluções quantitativas;
  • Experiência prática com ferramentas de versionamento (Git), notebooks (Jupyter/Colab) e ambientes de

desenvolvimento colaborativo;

  • Experiência prática com Google Cloud Platform, especialmente BigQuery, Cloud Storage, e Vertex AI;
  • Comunicação clara, postura colaborativa e foco em impacto para o negócio

Informações Adicionais

Estamos em crescimento: Nosso modelo de trabalho é híbrido, permitindo que o Dakier atue de forma remota e presencial;

Somos Modernos: por meio de um cartão Flash, você recebe o vale refeição, dando mais liberdade ao Dakier de como utilizar;

Transporte: realizamos o depósito direto no VT de acordo com a necessidade de passagem do Dakier até a unidade;

Saúde: Hoje disponibilizamos para o nosso Dakier a Assistência Médica e Odontológica, e também o Total Pass;

Mimo: Nossos Dakier tem desconto de 10% em todas as compras feitas em nosso do APP.

Requisitos

Estudos

Ensino Superior

Competências

SQL

MLOPS

PYTHON

Title: Cientista de Dados (área Business Development) - São Paulo/SP
HTML:
About The Team

Sobre a Shô

Aqui na Shô, acreditamos que cada membro de nossa equipe é fundamental para o nosso sucesso, e que diversidade de perspectivas e vivências são essenciais para movimentar nosso negócio e impulsionar o nosso propósito de mudar o mundo para melhor.

Fazer parte do nosso time é a oportunidade de se desenvolver dentro de uma cultura de muita agilidade. Se você ama assumir grandes responsabilidades e fazer o que nunca foi feito, a Shô é seu lugar. Aqui você terá grandes desafios, trabalhará em colaboração com um time diverso e contribuirá para o futuro do e-commerce no Brasil, criamos impacto positivo na vida de milhões de pessoas.

Modelo de Trabalho

Adotamos um modelo de trabalho híbrido, esse modelo permite que as pessoas ajustem seu ambiente de trabalho de acordo com suas necessidades pessoais, ao mesmo tempo em que promove a colaboração e interação no escritório.

Qual será a sua missão

Você atuará no time de Business Development e será responsável por estruturar e automatizar processos de coleta, classificação, organização e análise de dados que apoiem decisões estratégicas em um ambiente de negócio altamente dinâmico e competitivo.

Buscamos alguém com perfil técnico e aplicado, que saiba construir soluções escaláveis, com forte raciocínio analítico e autonomia.

Job Description

Como será o seu dia a dia

  • Projetar e implementar pipelines robustos para processamento de dados em larga escala;
  • Participar ativamente da evolução da esteira de dados e modelos, com foco em escalabilidade, confiabilidade e impacto;
  • Colaborar com desenvolvedores, analistas de negócio e stakeholders de outras áreas, mantendo uma comunicação clara e objetiva;
  • Desenvolver dashboards e relatórios com dados processados, apoiando a geração de insights para o negócio;
  • Construir soluções com mentalidade DevOps e MLOps, utilizando automações, versionamento, CI/CD e monitoramento.

Requirements

O que você precisa para assumir o desafio

  • Experiência sólida com Python e bibliotecas de dados e machine learning (Pandas, Scikit-learn, etc.);
  • Vivência com PySpark ou ferramentas de processamento distribuído;
  • Experiência no tratamento e classificação de dados textuais não estruturados (ex: nomes e descrições de produtos, marcas, categorias), usando regex, Fuzzy Matching, embeddings ou LLMs;
  • Experiência com machine learning aplicado a problemas como classificação e segmentação;
  • Domínio de SQL, com experiência em modelagem de dados, otimização de consultas e organização de bases relacionais para consumo analítico;
  • Habilidade de colaborar em equipes multidisciplinares, com boa comunicação e visão de negócio;
  • Diferencial: domínio de frameworks como TensorFlow ou PyTorch;
  • Diferencial: experiência com sistemas de recomendação, otimização ou personalização em larga escala;
  • Diferencial: experiência com ingestão de dados externos e integração com fontes diversas (APIs, arquivos, dados públicos em escala);
  • Diferencial: familiaridade com ferramentas de orquestração como Airflow ou Kubeflow;
  • Diferencial: vivência em ambientes de e-commerce ou mercados com alta complexidade competitiva.

Benefícios

  • Assistência médica e odontológica, estendendo-se aos dependentes;
  • Parceira com Gympass e TotalPass;
  • Vale Refeição/Alimentação flexível;
  • Vale Transporte, Vale Mobilidade ou Estacionamento no local;
  • Benefício flexível;
  • Zenklub;
  • Bônus anual discricionário, atrelado à performance.

VEM FAZER HISTÓRIA COM A GENTE.

O QUE TE FAZ ÚNICO, NOS FAZ MELHORES! 🧡

Title: Data Scientist Specialist
Description:
Sobre o Bradesco

O Bradesco é um dos maiores grupos financeiros do Brasil, com uma história marcada pelo pioneirismo e inovação. Por meio da nossa carteira amplamente diversificada de produtos financeiros, serviços bancários e de seguros contribuímos com a realização das pessoas e o crescimento sustentável de empresas e sociedade. Venha fazer parte do nosso ecossistema financeiro e impactar a experiência de milhões de pessoas!

Saiba mais em https://banco.bradesco/html/classic/sobre/index.shtm

Responsabilidades e atribuições

O que é o nosso time de Pricing ?

A área de Pricing é responsável pela definição e gestão estratégica de preços e condições financeiras dos produtos do banco, equilibrando rentabilidade, competitividade e risco. Atua com dados, modelagens e inteligência de mercado para apoiar decisões comerciais e impulsionar resultados sustentáveis em diversas linhas de negócio.

Modelo de trabalho: Híbrido (3 dias presenciais e 2 dias remotos)

Unidade: Osasco/SP (Matriz)

Como será seu dia a dia?

Sendo Data Scientist Specialist, atuará na gerência do Pricing e suas principais atividades serão:



Elaborar curvas de demanda de produtos de crédito considerando atualizações nas características do cliente (e.g. produtos contratados, etapa do ciclo de vida), apoiando na definição da estratégia de precificação de produtos de crédito;
Elaboração das curvas de demanda para todos os produtos de crédito, alavancando a visão cliente e alterações nas dinâmicas de mercado. Monitorando continuamente a performance dos modelos existentes, realizando recalibrações e ajustes conforme necessário para garantir sua acurácia e relevância;
Conduzir análises de sensibilidade para entender como mudanças nas variáveis de precificação e nas condições de mercado afetam a demanda por empréstimos;
Traduzir os resultados dos modelos em insights acionáveis, ajudando a definir estratégias de taxas de juros, termos e condições de empréstimos que maximizem a rentabilidade e o volume, considerando a elasticidade da demanda.



Requisitos e Qualificações

O que você precisa ter ou saber?



Superior completo em áreas como Economia, Engenharia, Estatística, Ciência da Computação ou áreas correlatas.
Sólida experiência com modelagem de demanda (elasticidade), preferencialmente com produtos de crédito.



Será um diferencial se você tiver:



Experiência com modelagem financeira



O que nós oferecemos

No Bradesco valorizamos a saúde e bem-estar, oferecendo um extenso portfólio de benefícios a todas nossas pessoas funcionárias.



PLR ou Bônus: Conforme a elegibilidade de cargo*
Convênio Médico
Convênio Odontológico
Seguro de Vida
Vale Alimentação
Vale Refeição
13º Cesta Alimentação
Total Pass
Vale Transporte (adesão opcional)
Descontos em produtos e serviços em empresas parceiras
Previdência Privada (adesão opcional, com participação financeira da Organização Bradesco)
Viva Bem Bradesco: programa de saúde, bem-estar e qualidade de vida
Unibrad: Universidade Corporativa Bradesco
Isenção de Tarifas: condições especiais em diversos produtos e serviços
Auxílio Creche ou Babá
Licença Paternidade estendida de 20 dias
Licença Maternidade de 180 dias, acompanhamento assistencial da gestação até o pós-parto

Title: Cientista de Dados Junior | CRM | Vaga Afirmativa para Pessoas com Deficiência
HTML:
O C6 Bank está comprometido com a construção de um ambiente mais diverso e inclusivo, valorizando a diversidade e promovendo a equidade dentro dos nossos times. Como parte dessa estratégia, buscamos aumentar a representatividade de pessoas com deficiência em nossas contratações, incluindo vagas especialmente direcionadas a esse grupo. Essa ação está alinhada aos nossos compromissos como empresa em ampliar cada vez mais a diversidade dos nossos times e fortalecer nossa cultura inclusiva.

Conheça mais sobre nossos compromissos em: https://www.c6bank.com.br/blog/diversidade-e-inclusao-no-c6-bank

Essa vaga é afirmativa para pessoas com deficiência.

Nossa área de Ciência de Dados

A nossa equipe é dedicada a aplicar habilidades em Programação, Estatística e Machine Learning para criar soluções que impulsionam as decisões estratégicas dos nossos parceiros de negócio, desde a concepção até a implementação. O nosso ambiente de trabalho é caracterizado pela colaboração, leveza e promoção da autonomia, estando sempre próximos dos times de negócios e com um firme compromisso na entrega final. Nossa cultura é robusta, centrada na inovação e na construção de relacionamentos autênticos com clientes e colaboradores.

Suas atividades como CSixer

  • Trabalhar com parceiros de negócios, engenheiros de dados e times de tecnologia para desenvolvimento e deploy de soluções de machine learning como parte dos produtos;
  • Analisar dados para validar hipóteses e gerar insights de negócio;
  • Manipular dados para tratamento, limpeza e exploração;
  • Implementar, testar, fazer deploy, documentar e depurar processos de dados e de machine learning;
  • Contribuir com os repositórios de código e documentação da equipe e qualificar a discussão técnica com referências científicas e metodológicas.


Requisitos e experiência

  • Desejável Inglês avançado para leitura (artigos técnicos) e escrita (documentação de modelos e APIs);
  • Experiência com técnicas de modelagem descritiva e preditiva;
  • Experiência na construção de ETL usando SQL;
  • Experiência com Python e/ou R para construção de modelo.


Nossos benefícios

  • Vale-Refeição;
  • Vale-Alimentação;
  • Plano de saúde e odontológico;
  • Auxílio-Creche;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • WellHub;
  • Conexa | Psicologia Viva - Terapia online sem custo;
  • Cartão de Crédito C6 Bank Carbon;
  • Carbon Spa - Salão de beleza localizado em nosso escritório;
  • Sala de amamentação;
  • Empresa Cidadã - Prorrogação do prazo da licença-maternidade e licença-paternidade;
  • Estacionamento;
  • Bicicletário;
  • Vestiário;
  • Espaço de convivência - Videogame, mesa de sinuca, playball, churrasqueira, chopeira, lanchonete, diversos locais de descanso, redes, cesta de basquete e horta colaborativa e orgânica.


C6 BANK

O BANCO DA SUA VIDA

Atendemos pessoas físicas, MEIs e PMEs em todos os estados do Brasil. Sem agências físicas, oferecemos mais de 90 produtos e serviços financeiros feitos para todos os perfis de clientes.

Estamos localizados em São Paulo-SP e contamos com mais de 3.000 CSixers que estão sempre a mil por hora. Em pouco mais de cinco anos, conquistamos muitos prêmios e reconhecimentos.

No C6 Bank, acreditamos que a diversidade impulsiona a inovação e fortalece nosso ambiente de trabalho. Por isso, promovemos uma cultura inclusiva, que valoriza a equidade e garante oportunidades para todas as pessoas, independentemente de raça, cor, idade, credo, deficiência, nacionalidade, estado civil, orientação sexual, identidade ou expressão de gênero. Aqui, todo mundo é bem-vindo para ser quem é.

Confira mais informações no vídeo abaixo:

Title: Cientista da Dados JR
Description:
Faça parte de um time que gera valor!

Nascemos em 2001 para transformar a infraestrutura do sistema financeiro brasileiro. Desde então, nos tornamos referência em tecnologia e dados, desenvolvendo soluções que movimentam trilhões de reais em transações com segurança, eficiência e inteligência.

Somos especialistas em registro de ativos, pagamentos digitais e dados que viram decisões estratégicas. Aqui, você trabalha com propósito, inovação e impacto real.

Nossos valores nos movem:

• Apaixonados por clientes — buscamos encantar, não apenas atender.

• Gente que gosta de gente — diversidade, inclusão e desenvolvimento fazem parte de quem somos.

• Integridade no DNA — ética e transparência em todas as relações.

• Direcionados por dados — inteligência como base para decisões consistentes.

• Inovação na veia — criamos, testamos e evoluímos todos os dias.

• Fanáticos por resultados — entregamos impacto, não apenas esforço.

Diversidade é parte integral do nosso negócio.

Todas as nossas vagas são destinadas a todos os perfis. Valorizamos diferentes vivências, trajetórias e olhares.

Se você é apaixonado(a) por tecnologia, quer crescer e ajudar a transformar o mercado financeiro e outros setores, aqui é o seu lugar.




🚀 Venha gerar valor junto conosco. Inscreva-se!




Responsabilidades e atribuições




Auxliar na produção, teste e experimentação de modelos estatísticos aplicados as diferente áreas de negócio;
Criar, manter e atualizar relatórios analíticos para a squad e para o negócio;
Trazer insights e conduzir experimentos junto as áreas de negócios;
Auxiliar o time no desenvolvimento de modelos preditivos com técnicas de machine learning para resolução de problemas de negócio;




Requisitos e qualificações




Experiência:

Atuação prévia em projetos de automação, engenharia de software com CI/CD, e/ou monitoramento de produtos de dados.

Machine Learning
Deployment

Programação
Python

ML-Flow

Ciência da computação

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

R25_0014938

In 100 countries around the world, NielsenIQ provides clients the most complete understanding of how the FMCG market evolves and what consumers buy. As a global leader in measurement and information, we believe providing our clients a precise understanding of the consumer is the key to making the right decisions -- decisions that can lead to profitable growth. At NielsenIQ, we’re always innovating to keep pace with emerging market trends and the increasingly diverse, demanding and connected consumer.

The Product organization drives forward our product strategy for NielsenIQ’s product portfolio. From measurement strategy to delivery mechanism and applications suite, the Product Organization identifies market opportunities and shapes product offerings to enable our clients’ strategic business decision making.

Job Description

Being a Data Scientist in the Junior Data Science, you will play a critical role in developing the next generation of solutions we offer our clients, powered by algorithms and AI and leveraging large volumes of internal data, client data and third-party data.

You’ll be actively participating with other team members in the overall Product creation process. You will be participating with other team members in the overall Product creation process. You’ll work alongside a group of talented individuals with different areas of expertise including best in class data scientists.

On a daily basis you’ll be expected to:


Read, write, comment, maintain, enhance, and share legible, well documented, and quality computer code translated from technical specification to fulfill product requirements
Adapt and plan implementation of statistical and analytical models (including ML/AI approaches) to production platform, guiding their integration with other production processes
Maintain data integrity and quality throughout the development lifecycle
Actively participate in Agile workflows with the broader team which inc


Qualifications


Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or related field requiring outstanding analytical expertise and strong technical background
3+ years of experience in data science/analytics/software engineering related product development and/or data solutions development
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning methodologies: Sampling theory, Probability Theory, Variation analysis, Outlier identification techniques, Regressions, Classification, Time series analysis, Clustering, Neural Networks, etc
Ability to prototype as well as support pilot programs for R&D purposes. The primary areas include – but not limited to – trend analyses, identifying gaps for improvements in coverage, representation/sampling, bias reduction, indirect estimation, data integration, automation, generalization, harmonization as well as working with different data sources
Proficient in Python, SQL, Statistical packages (scipy, sklearn, statsmodels, etc), and version control (Github)
Proficient in English language


Preferred:


Experience with Cloud computing, ETL, advanced data processing techniques (Spark, pySpark, Hadoop, etc)


Additional Information


$2,000.00 - $4,000.00 BRL Monthly Salary
Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

R25_0014938

In 100 countries around the world, NielsenIQ provides clients the most complete understanding of how the FMCG market evolves and what consumers buy. As a global leader in measurement and information, we believe providing our clients a precise understanding of the consumer is the key to making the right decisions -- decisions that can lead to profitable growth. At NielsenIQ, we’re always innovating to keep pace with emerging market trends and the increasingly diverse, demanding and connected consumer.

The Product organization drives forward our product strategy for NielsenIQ’s product portfolio. From measurement strategy to delivery mechanism and applications suite, the Product Organization identifies market opportunities and shapes product offerings to enable our clients’ strategic business decision making.

Job Description

Being a Data Scientist in the Junior Data Science, you will play a critical role in developing the next generation of solutions we offer our clients, powered by algorithms and AI and leveraging large volumes of internal data, client data and third-party data.

You’ll be actively participating with other team members in the overall Product creation process. You will be participating with other team members in the overall Product creation process. You’ll work alongside a group of talented individuals with different areas of expertise including best in class data scientists.

On a daily basis you’ll be expected to:

  • Read, write, comment, maintain, enhance, and share legible, well documented, and quality computer code translated from technical specification to fulfill product requirements
  • Adapt and plan implementation of statistical and analytical models (including ML/AI approaches) to production platform, guiding their integration with other production processes
  • Maintain data integrity and quality throughout the development lifecycle
  • Actively participate in Agile workflows with the broader team which inc

Qualifications

  • Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or related field requiring outstanding analytical expertise and strong technical background
  • 3+ years of experience in data science/analytics/software engineering related product development and/or data solutions development
  • Knowledge of statistical and machine learning methodologies: Sampling theory, Probability Theory, Variation analysis, Outlier identification techniques, Regressions, Classification, Time series analysis, Clustering, Neural Networks, etc
  • Ability to prototype as well as support pilot programs for R&D purposes. The primary areas include – but not limited to – trend analyses, identifying gaps for improvements in coverage, representation/sampling, bias reduction, indirect estimation, data integration, automation, generalization, harmonization as well as working with different data sources
  • Proficient in Python, SQL, Statistical packages (scipy, sklearn, statsmodels, etc), and version control (Github)
  • Proficient in English language

Preferred:

  • Experience with Cloud computing, ETL, advanced data processing techniques (Spark, pySpark, Hadoop, etc)

Additional Information

  • $2,000.00 - $4,000.00 BRL Monthly Salary
  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning

Our Benefits
